The send_arp_for_ha option was removed in neutron's pike release
and neutron will automatically send three ARP requests for each

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron/pike.html

commit_message:
Remove send_arp_for_ha option

The send_arp_for_ha option was removed in neutron's pike release
and neutron will automatically send three ARP requests for each
address on a port.

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron/pike.html

Closes-Bug: 1735215
Change-Id: I312820e1a7818cd20472052bf93e8d2f44d21816
(cherry picked from commit 2dc81d6b6065b2f25eade02ee927cce49c37fc2e)

commit_message:
Add proper version of oslo.serialization

The latest oslo.serialization requires version of oslo.utils which
conflicts with limitation from our requirements.txt

Change-Id: I277c56307961ee8c301bedf5a91ecc6b99a15d93

subject: Use a session for keystone auth
messages:
[{'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2017-11-21 21:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2017-11-22 13:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2017-11-27 14:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2017-11-29 17:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2017-11-29 21:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-30 15:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Great patch! We had a similar one for ironic lately and ended up admitting the same type of change. However, it seems like it is a recurring pattern that the endpoint has to be overridden in most cases and the session has to be initialized with the service auth instead of the keystone one. 

Could you adjust the get_session_and_auth API to better meet these criteria? I guess it would result in even more code reduction.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:32:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Andras, I see your point - but I'd be happy for this work to move forward. Despite not fully abstracting the new approach we are still reducing the line count."}, {'account_id': 7065, 'date': '2017-12-04 17:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Great patch! We had a similar one for ironic lately and ended up
 > admitting the same type of change. However, it seems like it is a
 > recurring pattern that the endpoint has to be overridden in most
 > cases and the session has to be initialized with the service auth
 > instead of the keystone one.
 > 
 > Could you adjust the get_session_and_auth API to better meet these
 > criteria? I guess it would result in even more code reduction.
 > 
 > Thanks!

I am working on a follow-up patch that will address this.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> > Great patch! We had a similar one for ironic lately and ended up
 > > admitting the same type of change. However, it seems like it is a
 > > recurring pattern that the endpoint has to be overridden in most
 > > cases and the session has to be initialized with the service auth
 > > instead of the keystone one.
 > >
 > > Could you adjust the get_session_and_auth API to better meet
 > these
 > > criteria? I guess it would result in even more code reduction.
 > >
 > > Thanks!
 > 
 > I am working on a follow-up patch that will address this.

Thanks Brad!'}]

commit_message:
Use a session for keystone auth

Update the following OpenStack clients to use sessions in their actions

Nova
Neutron
Keystone
Glance
Cinder
Heat

Also removes some extra code from Zaqar and Swift client creation.

Change-Id: Ifa24d914a0b3266eb3f18dcb2a26ce73902c55e3

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit tests directly

This commit switches to use stestr command to run unit tests directly.
Recently, the latest ostestr command uses stestr instead of testr.
However, we should use stestr directly because it's simple and
straight forward. There is no reason to use ostestr for unit tests
anymore.

Modeled after Iff4abef50178bdc83b868eed4a906e22d790762b

Change-Id: Ie50cd57e87bc049c29b86fce67cc1a2061dad690

commit_message:
Add EndpointMapOverride parameter

This allows overriding the calculated EndpointMap, which is useful
in some cases such as deploying compute-only stacks which reference
some existing endpoints from a controlplane stack.

The values can be generated like:

openstack stack output show controlplane EndpointMap

Or with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521969/ applied to heatclient:

openstack stack output show controlplane EndpointMap --format yaml \
 | grep -A 1000 output_value | sed "s/^/  /" \
 | sed "1s/^/parameter_defaults:\n  EndpointMapOverride:\n/" | sed "/output_value/d"

Change-Id: Ie1185b99db1b0db93acaf0deae05bd7b707b442f

commit_message:
Include barbican worker and listener images if API is enabled

Due to limitations in the puppet manifest and the need to go forward
with the barbican work, we will trigger the usage of the worker and
listener images when the barbican API is used.

In other words, for the near future, we will require the notifier and
listener to be in the same "pod" as the barbican API.

I'm leaving the listener and worker services entries there because we do
hope to separate these at some point.

Change-Id: I154450c96e25a045a16cba23eb7fd28e309a9a60

[{'created': '2017-12-02 13:51:03.000000000', 'message': "Run rabbitmq_policy,rabbitmq_user with pacemaker

When using the docker/services/pacemaker/rabbitmq.yaml service
it appears that custom rabbit users and policies aren't being
initialized.

For non-pacemaker containerized rabbit this typically occurs
in the docker_puppet_tasks. With pacemaker enabled however we
are doing this sort of initialization via the _init_bundle
container.

This causes issues for some integrations (Veritas) that require
extra rabbit users.

Change-Id: I521c7468ef3677ebfd645f609c0b76ba30df7c86

are doing this sort of initialization via the _init_bundle

This causes issues for some integrations (Veritas) that require
extra rabbit users.

Change-Id: I521c7468ef3677ebfd645f609c0b76ba30df7c86
(cherry picked from commit 9515af75aebc32eaba3661cbb2f7e647a81f1248)

commit_message:
Run rabbitmq_policy,rabbitmq_user with pacemaker

When using the docker/services/pacemaker/rabbitmq.yaml service
it appears that custom rabbit users and policies aren't being
initialized.

For non-pacemaker containerized rabbit this typically occurs
in the docker_puppet_tasks. With pacemaker enabled however we
are doing this sort of initialization via the _init_bundle
container.

This causes issues for some integrations (Veritas) that require
extra rabbit users.

Change-Id: I521c7468ef3677ebfd645f609c0b76ba30df7c86
(cherry picked from commit 9515af75aebc32eaba3661cbb2f7e647a81f1248)

commit_message:
Reintroduce TripleoPackages in the default Controller service.

Without this service, no package upgrade can happen on the host.  This
breaks upgrade ci.  For instance the puppet modules (for instance) are not
upgraded at all, neither is os-net-config and so on…

Change-Id: Ic050bd58065904f1c55d6a71c7bd4b09ba72d19d
Closes-Bug: #1734353

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 20:27:28.000000000', 'message': "Allow support for subunit2junitxml < 1.2

Versions of subunit2junitxml less than 1.2 do not support the
syntax we have in the validate tempest role. Namely:

  subunit2junitxml foo bar

Instead they need the destination file specified with '--output-to'

  subunit2junitxml foo --output-to=bar

As far as I can tell, the newer versions of subunit still support
the '--output-to' syntax. As such, we should use the syntax that
supports all versions.

Closes-Bug: 1720859

Change-Id: I3b52db71bb1b1b1f0faf241038348e6dedca943f
"}]
commit_message:
Allow support for subunit2junitxml < 1.2

Versions of subunit2junitxml less than 1.2 do not support the
syntax we have in the validate tempest role. Namely:

  subunit2junitxml foo bar

Instead they need the destination file specified with '--output-to'

  subunit2junitxml foo --output-to=bar

As far as I can tell, the newer versions of subunit still support
the '--output-to' syntax. As such, we should use the syntax that
supports all versions.

Closes-Bug: 1720859

Change-Id: I3b52db71bb1b1b1f0faf241038348e6dedca943f

commit_message:
Fix SSL certs creation for ipv6

In cases where TLS and IPv6 is enabled in the overcloud, quickstart
still passed an IPv4 value for PublicVirtualFixedIps. This fixes that.

Co-Author: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Co-Author: Sagi Shnaidman <sshnaidm@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I09849c0915e7de7cf3b6de92457dfb5ff29f05ff

commit_message:
Memoize docker uploader

This change avoids recreating the DockerImageUploader for every
upload.  Reusing the same DockerImageUploader will allow state to be
tracked so that concurrency and cleanup can be implemented within the
uploader.

Change-Id: I4cffdea9860cf98f19bc318a8fb4d929d6463fef
Partial-Bug: #1708965

commit_message:
Update consistent repo files for periodic jobs

Make consistent repo files to be exactly as hash promotions, but
with consistent repo instead of tripleo-ci-testing.
It's used for periodic jobs which don't promote, for example
reproducing promotions.

Change-Id: I2ca859115460708d065b9e4a7db51a07621f3f21

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

- gate-heat-specs-docs http://logs.openstack.org/06/175706/3/check/gate-heat-specs-docs/47dba69/ : FAILURE in 1m 42s'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2015-04-21 06:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

please convert to unix line endings "\n"'}, {'account_id': 12259, 'date': '2015-04-21 07:52:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

You may want to use dos2unix or tr command to fix this '\r'. Then you will have to format the text using some tool (vim or something IDE)."}, {'account_id': 12259, 'date': '2015-04-21 07:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Also, please fix the commit message to just have

blueprint: support-server-health-monitoring-solution 

instead of,

Implements: buleprint support-server-health-monitoring-solution'}, {'account_id': 10999, 'date': '2015-04-21 08:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 08:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

(1 comment)

Also, please fix this \r thigys;)'}, {'account_id': 10999, 'date': '2015-04-21 08:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-21 08:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-heat-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/06/175706/5/check/gate-heat-specs-docs/f857844//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 58s'}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2015-04-21 08:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10487, 'date': '2015-04-21 09:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Kindly add dependency on https://review.openstack.org/174262 for monasca resources. 

Also it would be nice if you can improve the document further to be more read-friendly and strip off the invalid whitespaces. thanks.'}, {'account_id': 12259, 'date': '2015-04-21 17:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2015-04-23 23:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10787, 'date': '2015-04-24 05:40:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I'll copy my previous comment so it won't be lost in discussion:

I am strong supporter of heat being autohealing engine for tenant resources (vms and so), I am very happy to see that others agree. That being said, there is problem, heat is executor rather than decider. By executor I mean heat can perform tasks (updates of resources for example) in correct order, it know how to perform complicated tasks just by parsing template. Heat does not decide what to do in given situation (in reality before convergence stage 2 lands, it doesn't really know what is current situation alltogether). While your blueprint suggest that montioring should be done elsewhere, which is correct approach, you also want to make autohealing decisions inside heat, and I don't agree with that. Problem of correct diagnostics and decisions about healing solution is often much more complicated than simply too much memory => restart of VM. While heat would be correct place to perform certain autohealing tasks, we should perform diagnostics elsewhere (congress maybe?)."}, {'account_id': 14331, 'date': '2015-04-26 08:31:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

I'd like to explore Monasca's capabilities for application level monitoring as well. The suggested constructs can be a good start (see preliminary comments inline) as long as we agree it's going into heat."}, {'account_id': 14331, 'date': '2015-04-26 11:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Currently -1 as we need to further check how to express Monasca in heat.'}, {'account_id': 14331, 'date': '2015-04-26 11:25:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

@Michal, I agree that remediation actions should be take outside of the executor engine (heat).
And since we all agree that monitoring should be done also by external service (ceilometer, and monasca in our case) it sounds intuitive for me to express Monasca's Alarm types in heat template (just like we have it for Ceilometer alarm) and be able to bind it with scale-URIs and/or Mistral's workflow when a more complex remediation action flow is needed."}, {'account_id': 10999, 'date': '2015-08-27 06:29:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thank you everyone's comments

@Michal,@Avi
Does it mean now we can use the workflow to replace the action process when generate a alarm?"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-12-04 22:32:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

I agree with the other folks here - I don't think Heat is the place to do this, because I don't think a predefined list of actions will ever be sufficient. Mistral is right service to handle this because it allows users to customise the actions.

Here's an example Heat template that allows us to do what you're talking about (using a Mistral workflow for recovery) using alarms from Aodh:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat-templates/tree/hot/autohealing

In principle the same could work with Monasca - you might need to add support for delivering alarms to a Zaqar queue."}]

commit_message:
Change deprecated nova_metadata_ip option

Neutron's pike release has deprecated nova_metadata_ip in favor
of nova_metadata_host. This patch updates the configuration
option.

Closes-Bug: 1735220
Change-Id: Ifbcb44cac9c79dd178c18d5931227801aa034a04

commit_message:
Add scope_types to RuleDefault objects

This change will help oslo.policy consume different levels of scope
and enforce proper admin-ness across OpenStack. The idea is that once
keystone has the ability to issue system-scoped tokens, we can start
enforcing partial scope checks in `Enforcer.enforce()`.

bp add-scope-to-policy

Change-Id: I7fa171d859d82939511f8279e4e9464f792ed2cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 21:07:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't index the devstack summary logs

The devstack summary logs are being picked up by logstash workers but
they are a proper subset of the full devstack log which we also index.
Avoid duplicative indexing by excluding the summary file.

This also addresses an issue with crm114 indexing these files with each
of them ending up with its own data dir due to timestamp data in the
filenames.

Change-Id: Ia397a3ceef0bf9f2198b4b6f9956d5b3dc9abcef
"}]
commit_message:
Don't index the devstack summary logs

The devstack summary logs are being picked up by logstash workers but
they are a proper subset of the full devstack log which we also index.
Avoid duplicative indexing by excluding the summary file.

This also addresses an issue with crm114 indexing these files with each
of them ending up with its own data dir due to timestamp data in the
filenames.

Change-Id: Ia397a3ceef0bf9f2198b4b6f9956d5b3dc9abcef

commit_message:
Clean-up zuul.d/ files

Create a new base job: legacy-ipa-dsvm-base

Define 'irrelevant-files' in legacy-ipa-dsvm-base and remove them from
project.yaml. This means we only define 'irrelevant-files' once. Also
makes project.yaml much easier to read.

Fix the 'irrelevant-files' section to make sure we do test
when changes to 'requirements.txt'.

Remove the 'branches:' section from the experimental job
'ipa-tempest-dsvm-partition-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-python3'

Sort the jobs lists in project.yaml.

Change-Id: Idbace38e0558e8a80e2d405ea0f6a0698989e140

subject: Handle race condition deleting security group rule
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2017-11-29 15:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:58:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2017-12-04 17:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-12-04 19:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2017-12-04 19:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 15:19:50.000000000', 'message': 'Handle race condition deleting security group rule

It is possible that during the `_update_security_group_rules` operation,
the security group rule which is to be deleted gets removed by some
other external operation.   If this happens, it raises a NotFound
exception is not handled which can lead to a load balancer stuck in
a PENDING_DELETE status.

Depends-On: I97b52b80efb33749647229a55147a08afa112dd2
Change-Id: Ic9ebe8392758f3de5fc6a94f815f83d6de113188
Story: 2001300
Task: 5851
(cherry picked from commit 709a23cdce016795571695983e38bc8e8b38d355)
'}, {'created': '2017-12-04 17:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'Handle race condition deleting security group rule

It is possible that during the `_update_security_group_rules` operation,
the security group rule which is to be deleted gets removed by some
other external operation.   If this happens, it raises a NotFound
exception is not handled which can lead to a load balancer stuck in

commit_message:
Handle race condition deleting security group rule

It is possible that during the `_update_security_group_rules` operation,
the security group rule which is to be deleted gets removed by some
other external operation.   If this happens, it raises a NotFound
exception is not handled which can lead to a load balancer stuck in
a PENDING_DELETE status.

Change-Id: Ic9ebe8392758f3de5fc6a94f815f83d6de113188
Story: 2001300
Task: 5851
(cherry picked from commit 709a23cdce016795571695983e38bc8e8b38d355)

commit_message:
Added a version to Vitrage templates

Added a new "version" field to the metadata section of Vitrage templates, in order to support future enhancements that are not backward-compatible. The default version is 1.
Version 2 will be added in anther change (with execute-mistral changes), together with a mechanism for running the correct validator and loader per-version.

Change-Id: I25a7bf50a2ab7277f5bbdc551bf676c62dfd6fdc
Implements: blueprint refactor-execute-mistral-definition

commit_message:
Remove shade-functional-devstack-legacy

It doesn't work - and won't work until we sort out the alternate
mechanism of installing old clouds. Stop running it for now - it's just
wasting build resources.

Change-Id: Iebcadd5ea3e89c789c203c8f7690fb9e9c500046

commit_message:
pycrypto is dead; long live cryptography

In 4.17.0 keystonemiddleware switched to cryptography and we are only
installing pycrypto for keystonemiddlewares encryption. This reflects
that change.

Change-Id: Ib9027151edae92b4fe9da3423f10002dd2980cdf

commit_message:
Explicitly pull images before docker run

By pulling any missing required images, a pull failure will result in
an early failure with a clear cause. For detached containers, this is
improved error handling than having a container which fails
to start.

Change-Id: Ifa0257cbeadd3da9be756edf6a729c90141c238f
Closes-Bug: #1733941

commit_message:
Fix Zuul jobs

The jobs are not working with Zuul v3 as is, we need
to update all job configuration and add a new job

1) Add os-api-ref-nova-src job

Replace the legacy version with a new shiny one.

2)
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

Follow https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh, we can build without it.

Depends-On: I97448d681e3e48753496818fa248ee96dd36d65b

commit_message:
scenario002: enable panko and ceilo-compute-agent

To enable autoscaling tests in scenario002 here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504149/5

These two services must be enabled.

And notification must be enabled.

Change-Id: I000c36797f01c704ca9716b2bcfa9bcc2d75417e

commit_message:
Fix networking settings for ObjectStorage role

The role name is actually "ObjectStorage", not "SwiftStorage". This
leads do failing deployments if one or more ObjectStorage nodes are
deployed on the overcloud.

Closes-Bug: 1727475
Change-Id: I96fd27bdad5d417f23550ecc3387d81fd3c5418a
(cherry picked from commit 65d38fa8de6278512de8577c0dd8935b57da8422)

Addition of Nuage bridge MTU parameter

This change provides support for non-default MTU configuration on
the compute nodes. Allows to configure bridge MTU value.

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I18b21a396b8df4224cb21ce5b8fd062f80604167

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I55acb1328677f40b923bde37cefc2ba5bb2bcfdb

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I26b56d4e02fc70ab62c2a08afe634367b403738a

subject: Add mock to avoid writing missing files to disk
messages: [{'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2017-12-04 11:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2017-12-04 11:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nEven though the backport was somewhat messy, this is low risk because it only affects unit tests. It should help reduce some of the random failures we sometimes get when temporary directories get created during UT.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 11:41:50.000000000', 'message': "Add mock to avoid writing missing files to disk

The 'fake' file was being created and left on disk when running the
unit tests, sometimes causing random failures during directory
creation. This mocks the function in all tests to avoid this, and adds
a new unit test specific to it to ensure we don't lose coverage.

Conflicts:
        tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Backport notes: Two tests started failing after the cherry-pick. They
both pass on master thanks to commit ca8e84. In the backport:

* test_tht_deploy was fixed by removing the hardcoded temporary path to
  use the TempDir fixtures, as in that commit;

* test_environment_dirs_env_files_not_found was fixed by reenabling the
  newly mocked _download_missing_files_from_plan function. The
  directory structure gets created in the temporary directory, which
  has a unique name and gets cleaned up at the end of the
  test. Therefore it does not reintroduce the original issue this
  backport means to fix.

Change-Id: I6cf6ec5e85af4a748e00383f7ee65636eb5a3251
Closes-Bug: #1732010
(cherry picked from commit c96d2e1e74b25105016ef5f308c789fecdad8ed5)
"}]
commit_message:
Add mock to avoid writing missing files to disk

The 'fake' file was being created and left on disk when running the
unit tests, sometimes causing random failures during directory
creation. This mocks the function in all tests to avoid this, and adds
a new unit test specific to it to ensure we don't lose coverage.

Conflicts:
        tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Backport notes: Two tests started failing after the cherry-pick. They
both pass on master thanks to commit ca8e84. In the backport:

* test_tht_deploy was fixed by removing the hardcoded temporary path to
  use the TempDir fixtures, as in that commit;

* test_environment_dirs_env_files_not_found was fixed by reenabling the
  newly mocked _download_missing_files_from_plan function. The
  directory structure gets created in the temporary directory, which
  has a unique name and gets cleaned up at the end of the
  test. Therefore it does not reintroduce the original issue this
  backport means to fix.

Change-Id: I6cf6ec5e85af4a748e00383f7ee65636eb5a3251
Closes-Bug: #1732010
(cherry picked from commit c96d2e1e74b25105016ef5f308c789fecdad8ed5)

[{'created': '2017-07-08 01:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Flesh out basic test cases for global roles

This still needs the implementation in order to pass. It should
also be refactored so that it includes groups since global roles
also apply to groups.

bp global-roles

Change-Id: I55ce53dfc95e6ac96ee887a3695e98bd6858f6ff
'}, {'created': '2017-07-11 19:34:10.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Implement global role assignments

This is an early PoC of implementing global role assignments. A
subsequent series of patches will introduce scoping logic to generate
globally-scoped tokens.

bp global-roles

Change-Id: I55ce53dfc95e6ac96ee887a3695e98bd6858f6ff

Implement global role assignments for groups

bp global-roles

Change-Id: I55ce53dfc95e6ac96ee887a3695e98bd6858f6ff

commit_message:
Implement global role assignments for users

A subsequent patch will apply this logic to group.

bp global-roles

Change-Id: I10e8cfa25b2b6b47dd149d6018d239c6583eaa42

subject: Implement manager logic for global roles

commit_message:
Implement manager logic for global roles

Make it so the assignment manager knows how to handle business logic
for global roles. This change doesn't expose anything through to the
end user. That will come at a later time when the global roles API
is implemented in the controller layer.

bp global-roles

Change-Id: I2f01f3ff1226162593ab103c1fcdd01891a055a1

subject: Implement backend logic for global roles

commit_message:
Implement backend logic for global roles

Introduce the plumbing so that we can reuse the existing assignment
driver to store records for global roles.

bp global-roles

Change-Id: I0d213042e17e27a559795d799b16d8701117fece

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I30b48b58d368c2d79d3407735d2a082b3b46d2fb

commit_message:
Assert default project id is not domain

If using default project id when creating user, make sure
the project is not a domain.
This patch add the note to the description of default_project_id
in api ref.

Change-Id: Iedda6df116f237cb68a882efff6f3e19c6ee8e72

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 08:26:34.000000000', 'message': "vGPU: XenAPI: get vgpu stats from hypervisor

This commit is to get vGPU resource stats from XenAPI.
It contains the following data for vGPU types:
* max_heads: maximal display heas
* model_name: vGPU type's name in XenAPI
* total amount: the capacity of the vGPUs

Each GPU group may have serveral vGPU types. All will
be reported by XenAPI. The next commit will use vGPU
type white list to filter the vGPU types.

Change-Id: I2f9cf80b71b50a4b8e011a4a8e40474cc02baba7
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu
"}, {'created': '2017-10-18 10:07:29.000000000', 'message': "vGPU: XenAPI: get vgpu stats from hypervisor

This commit is to get vGPU resource stats from XenAPI.
It contains the following data for vGPU types:
* max_heads: maximal display heas
* model_name: vGPU type's name in XenAPI
* total amount: the capacity of the vGPUs

The PGPU group and vGPU types's uuid will be used to create
the child resource provider's name in nested-RP, so that
it can mapping the resource allocation back to PGPU group
and vGPU type at booting instance.

Each GPU group may have serveral vGPU types. All will
be reported by XenAPI. The next commit will use vGPU
type white list to filter the vGPU types.

Change-Id: I2f9cf80b71b50a4b8e011a4a8e40474cc02baba7
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu
Depends-On: I54cd775d030a3856df550daa8e83f968a22f2d8d
"}, {'created': '2017-10-27 08:33:24.000000000', 'message': "vGPU: XenAPI: get vgpu stats from hypervisor

This commit is to get vGPU resource stats from XenAPI.
It contains the following data for vGPU types:
* max_heads: maximal display heads which will be used to
  create inventory for VGPU resource class
* total amount: the capacity of the vGPUs which will be
  used to create inventory for VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD.
* model_name: vGPU type's name in XenAPI. vGPU types are
  filtered basing on model_name.
* PGPU group uuid and vGPU type's uuid:
  the identifier in XenAPI. We will use them to create
  the child resource provider's name in nested-RP, so that
  the vGPU resource allocation can be easily mapped back
  to the PGPU group and vGPU type at spawning instance.

Change-Id: I2f9cf80b71b50a4b8e011a4a8e40474cc02baba7
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

This commit is to get vGPU resource stats from XenAPI.
It contains the following data for vGPU types:

  basing on model_name.
* PGPU group uuid and vGPU type's uuid:
  The identifiers in XenAPI. We will use them to create
  the child resource provider's name in nested-RP, so that
  the vGPU resource allocation can be easily mapped back
  to the PGPU group and vGPU type at spawning instance.

Change-Id: I2f9cf80b71b50a4b8e011a4a8e40474cc02baba7

Once it's ready to use the nested resource providers, we
can support multiple vGPU types in a compute node. But
at the moment we only enable one vGPU type in a compute
node. The restriction is implemented by checking the
configure option of enabled_vgpu_type. If multiple vGPU
types are enabled, we will only use the first one.

Change-Id: I2f9cf80b71b50a4b8e011a4a8e40474cc02baba7

commit_message:
XenAPI: get vGPU stats from hypervisor

This commit is to get vGPU resource stats from XenAPI.
It contains the following data for vGPU types:
* total amount:
  The capacity of the vGPUs which will be used to create
  inventory data for ResourceClass.VGPU.
* max_heads:
  The maximal display heads which will be used to create
  inventory data for ResourceClass.VGPU_DISPLAY_HEAD.
* model_name:
  The vGPU type's name in XenAPI. The vGPU types are filtered
  basing on model_name.
* PGPU group uuid and vGPU type's uuid:
  The identifiers in XenAPI. We will use them to create
  the child resource provider's name in nested-RP, so that
  the vGPU resource allocation can be easily mapped back
  to the PGPU group and vGPU type at spawning instance.

Once it's ready to use the nested resource providers, we
can support multiple vGPU types in a compute node. But
at the moment we only enable one vGPU type in a compute
node. The restriction is implemented by checking the
configure option of enabled_vgpu_type. If multiple vGPU
types are enabled, we will only use the first one.

Change-Id: I2f9cf80b71b50a4b8e011a4a8e40474cc02baba7
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-27 23:27:49.000000000', 'message': 'Update volume-status waiter for new cinder attach

The new Cinder attach API treats attaching to a shelved instance
differently than the old code.  In the old case we fake things a
bit and mark the volume as attached, even though it's really not,
it's actually just reserved and there's no valid connector
or connection associated with it.

In the new (Cinder V3.27) Attach API's we instead give a more
accurate response, create an attachment record and mark the
volume as 'reserved' until the Instance is unhselved at which
time we complete the connection and move the volume to 'in-use'.

This patch modifes the volume_status waiter slightly so that it
can accept multiple statuses to consider "ok".  We also modify the
test_attach_volume_shelved_or_offload_server to specify that
either 'in-use' or 'reserved' are acceptable responses.  This way
we're still compatable with older combinatons of nova/cinder and
we also work with the new combination as well.

Change-Id: Ia84f4325ddb0080521241ace26f89d1161db9dca
'}, {'created': '2017-06-27 23:38:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update volume-status waiter for new cinder attach

The new Cinder attach API treats attaching to a shelved instance
differently than the old code.  In the old case we fake things a
bit and mark the volume as attached, even though it's really not,
it's actually just reserved and there's no valid connector
or connection associated with it.

In the new (Cinder V3.27) Attach API's we instead give a more
accurate response, create an attachment record and mark the
volume as 'reserved' until the Instance is unhselved at which
time we complete the connection and move the volume to 'in-use'.

This patch modifes the volume_status waiter slightly so that it
can accept multiple statuses to consider "ok".  We also modify the
test_attach_volume_shelved_or_offload_server and
test_detach_volume_shelved_or_offload_server tests to specify that
either 'in-use' or 'reserved' are acceptable responses.  This way
we're still compatable with older combinatons of nova/cinder and
we also work with the new combination as well.

commit_message:
Update volume-status waiter for new cinder attach

The new Cinder attach API treats attaching to a shelved instance
differently than the old code.  In the old case we fake things a
bit and mark the volume as attached, even though it's really not,
it's actually just reserved and there's no valid connector
or connection associated with it.

In the new (Cinder V3.27) Attach API's we instead give a more
accurate response, create an attachment record and mark the
volume as 'reserved' until the Instance is unhselved at which
time we complete the connection and move the volume to 'in-use'.

This patch modifes the volume_status waiter slightly so that it
can accept multiple statuses to consider "ok".  We also modify the
test_attach_volume_shelved_or_offload_server and
test_detach_volume_shelved_or_offload_server tests to specify that
either 'in-use' or 'reserved' are acceptable responses.  This way
we're still compatable with older combinatons of nova/cinder and
we also work with the new combination as well.

Change-Id: Ia84f4325ddb0080521241ace26f89d1161db9dca

commit_message:
Fix swift port conflict

To avoid any port conflict, whether on LB or on bare metal nodes,
we should make sure each service runs on its own port.

Here, we introduce a new variable, opendaylight_port, that maps
to upstream role port configuration ``nb_rest_port``.

Closes-Bug: 1735764
Depends-On: I55b310e6def8873ed5739f5f5176b867bc89443d
Needed-By: Ia91dc9c758a38f455e3b8ebb4aba65dbd13f409c
Change-Id: I49ff040ba96adb444f3f900190187b7607a0e256

commit_message:
Clean-up zuul.d/ files

Create a new base job: legacy-ipa-dsvm-base

Define 'irrelevant-files' in legacy-ipa-dsvm-base and remove them from
project.yaml. This means we only define 'irrelevant-files' once. Also
makes project.yaml much easier to read.

Fix the 'irrelevant-files' section to make sure we do test
when changes to 'requirements.txt'.

Remove the 'branches:' section from the experimental job
'ipa-tempest-dsvm-partition-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-python3'

Sort the jobs lists in project.yaml.

Change-Id: Idbace38e0558e8a80e2d405ea0f6a0698989e140
(cherry picked from commit 8ba851bf27918319fdc174f495d971857fb356e0)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iffcd4035b0d0a7765db9c6dfba1c9dff68076082

commit_message:
Shift image tests from test_operator

There are two image tests in test_operator that really belong in
test_image. Move them there. Also, clean up a few things in the image
tests (like using self.image_name as the image name for the image fakes)

commit_message:
Added nat_source flag for networks.

In some more complex clouds there can not only be more than one valid network
on a server that NAT can attach to, there can also be more than one valid
network from which to get a NAT address. Allow flagging a network so that it
can be found.

Change-Id: I3d8dd6d734a1013d2d4a43e11c3538c3a345820b

commit_message:
Update make_rest_client to work with version discovery

Using make_rest_client on clouds that put unversioned endpoints in the
catalog results in incorrectly set up adapters.

Add the plumbing to get_session_client to pass version args to
keystoneauth. Then use that from make_rest_client.

Change-Id: I69ad746f672ef0b12680e9db3c7b0c691c9f87e4

commit_message:
Protect against p_opt not having prompt attribute

In ansible/ansible#28746 it was reported that there are times
when a p_opt is getting here that does not have a prompt
attribute. Protecting against that is fairly easy to do.

Change-Id: Ia02528f4a107893e480135bc214aa156b8684507
Closes-Bug: #1717906

commit_message:
Treat clouds.yaml with one cloud like envvars

If there is only one cloud and that cloud is envvars, things work as
expected. If there is only one cloud in clouds.yaml and no envvars
cloud, we throw an error, even though it should be obvious which cloud
was intended.

Change-Id: Ia49d0fb2cc7dca36476d0e5ae3fe2b2aa1209e59

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 21:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'Remove tox_install.sh and just pass -c in tox

The tox_install.sh scripts are there to enable dealing with constraints
support. All of that can be accomplished directly, it turns out, by
simply adding the -c line to the requirements list.

Remove tox_install.sh and just set constraints directly.

Change-Id: I888ee148995c080f793f90e168613348283d0ff0
'}, {'created': '2017-11-30 00:03:03.000000000', 'message': 'Remove tox_install.sh and just pass -c in tox

support. All of that can be accomplished directly, it turns out, by
simply adding the -c line to the requirements list.

Remove tox_install.sh and just set constraints directly.

Change-Id: I888ee148995c080f793f90e168613348283d0ff0
'}, {'created': '2017-12-01 16:34:52.000000000', 'message': 'Remove tox_install.sh and just pass -c in tox

The tox_install.sh scripts are there to enable dealing with constraints

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh and just pass -c in tox

The tox_install.sh scripts are there to enable dealing with constraints
support. All of that can be accomplished directly, it turns out, by
simply adding the -c line to the requirements list.

Remove tox_install.sh and just set constraints directly.

Change-Id: I888ee148995c080f793f90e168613348283d0ff0

commit_message:
Replace legacy tips jobs with shiny new versions

For openstackclient we can use the new osc-tox-unit-tips jobs from the
openstackclient repo. For neutronclient, make a cliff-specific job.

Change-Id: I244bad5a7a65b5e988a6ccb9e6403e86f03a38ac
Depends-On: Ie0f3e9d7e221c9cdd3c5d726148f456246186ff4

commit_message:
py3: Fix use of iteritems in templates

Switch to using items for all dictionary iteration.

Change-Id: I465d0b53c3ff2eeb114b4a7f68ff6b124cb6362b
Closes-Bug: 1735797
(cherry picked from commit b0469d5927184b2b625529ac200944a2848b82c0)

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Iea38327f48caf8c060479dfa4f42f3124a87fee8

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I6303e8d4f375114d709a79ccb4e33698bd543554

commit_message:
Introduce fs035, ovb-ha-ipv6

Based on fs001, deploy fs035 with IPv6.
Some improvements will be done in the next iterations:
- enable tempest
- enable network-isolation-absolute

Also use one var for undercloud external network.

Change-Id: I5235e3f29fdb129281c76f1c70135580f640a112

commit_message:
Set api_version on tempest tests

* Follow the guide [1]
* Add admin credentials to test_containers. We need this to force
  delete containers.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/microversion_testing.html#how-to-implement-microversion-tests

Change-Id: I7b1a79cfb171b76f49d48bf86d233d8e544e3afc
Closes-Bug: #1732014

commit_message:
Use IPv6 PublicVirtualFixedIps when needed

In cases where TLS and IPv6 is enabled in the overcloud, quickstart
still passed an IPv4 value for PublicVirtualFixedIps. This fixes that.

Change-Id: I3ddce91330352563d69c4ee896f157bd74158da0

commit_message:
Fixes a link issue for pike documentation

The documentation reorganization did not make the pike release for this
project. This patch adds redirects for the global links into the per-release
documenation for Pike.

Closes-Bug: #1735349

Change-Id: I3b2397ffb1beddf737b0045383fa48a8317c563a

commit_message:
Remove sleep option from service handlers

The systemd module doesn't support the sleep option and this patch
removes it from the handlers.

Closes-Bug: 1735786
Change-Id: Ida1d83903dc4d3cd85029735a0882bf342d21dca
(cherry picked from commit 97f29d75c0806f2a44d33faaa26ccc3f1bff69d4)

commit_message:
Gather more logs when running tests

This change updates our log collection script so that it is once again
grabbing logs from services and containers but this time far more
conservatively.

Backport combined with https://review.openstack.org/524881

Depends-On: I3c1b755e4bed6a209c127258b79d3ef557caf19e
Change-Id: Ifae67fa3bb3dd790f806bc73de5068f0998cb4e6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
more tempest refactoring

replace the old filter by parameters method with general_utils match.
remove unicode to str method.
remove _get_value method.

Change-Id: I6e54d7894d05ed908715f5b7a26d35b54b51beb3

commit_message:
Remove keystone_token_driver variable

The memcache token driver was removed in Ocata and the only valid option
is sql, which is only used when keystone_token_provider is uuid.

Change-Id: I1db15e2553893b74d3f7d57d4d50ca2052be04e4
(cherry picked from commit 8019b5c190090af12f11c0e06eb4a4c26f3c5983)

Remove python-ironicclient

After an epic battle with time, the python-ironicclient has been
driven from the land of shade, and there will be joy!

Change-Id: I234e2fc9d1800607c22eb447dd3e77428221695e

commit_message:
De-client-ify fixed method get_nic_by_mac

Additionally removed traces of ironic exceptions
being parsed in operatorcloud.py and removed legacy
tasks related to port lookups.

Also remove patch machine task wrapper as that appears
to have been migrated previously.

Change-Id: Iee9e15f44b8375fdcf00ddba2b44afe217faf478

subject: Remove -U from pip install
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 18:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:39:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 18:30:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ied7749e097fba7552c7f95b15170bf124ffa1d04
"}]
commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ied7749e097fba7552c7f95b15170bf124ffa1d04

broken at some point in the past, since we didn't have tests.

commit_message:
Fix operator cloud get_nic_by_mac

Apparently, this method either never worked or was silently
broken at some point in the past, since we didn't have tests.

Added two tests and got the method back into working shape.

Change-Id: I26591549c082a2cd206f20fbcb7f1e3a1dde91c7

commit_message:
De-client-ify many baremetal calls

Update calls for numerous baremetal methods to utilize
the _baremetal_client calls instead of python-ironicclient.

Also corrected a minor baremetal port test and fixed the
base noauth test endpoint override as python-ironicclient
was previously injecting that for us.

Change-Id: I358a63a52067f7d48d71f0b23652491b2497fe43

commit_message:
Remove jinja2 delimiters from when

This patch removes Jinja2 delimiters from when clauses and fixes the
capitalization of task names to match the other tasks in the file.

Closes-Bug: 1735785
Change-Id: I16334a11c551026c593b1872a44ed68f786719a5
(cherry picked from commit 6cd15acb26b33ac9c7ecfdb725a8b45a4b92da86)

"}]
commit_message:
rabbitmq: don't wait for message ack/requeue

I don't see any obvious reason why we should wait ack/requeue is done.

This waiter have already be removed from amqp1.

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.messaging/tree/oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/controller.py#n242

So, this change remove it from rabbitmq driver too.

Closes-bug: #1734788

Change-Id: I5ecedc762596181be19410b863851a0054fd6579
(cherry picked from commit c38857e1101027a734a35f4e80bc4084fabc034b)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-09-20 20:17:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

I updated the code from neutron upstream, some major notes:

1. I might be wrong but I'd say that we do not need conj_manager logic for firewall groups. IIRC in neutron ovsfw this one was used to deal with remote security groups and as far as I know there is no such concept for firewall groups. But I may be wrong in any of the statements so it's worth checking out.
2. I ported 2 test modules (for rules and firewall) from neutron code base as well. 3 tests (at least) that I couldn't get to work right away are definitely worth looking at. They might be an indication that smth was missed.
3. I raised the question on irc about TRANSIENT table (# 60) and the fact that fwaas pipeline starts from table 41. Probably renaming the fwaas pipeline tables makes sense, though we don't have many options here as neutron ovsfw ones start at 71.

Looking forward for your reviews, this patch needs plenty of eyes."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-20 22:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Verified-1

Hi Inessa and chandanc,

> Please check my comment to PS28, concerns about table numbers and conj_ip_manager/remote group id for firewall groups still stand.

I'd recommend skip conj_ip_manager at the moment. We can go back if we want to optimize number of flows in case overlapping port ranges of firewall rules as Iwamoto's comment at [1]. IIUC, we should improve driver code by add new cookie for this driver to avoid cleanup flows from other driver (security group, qos) or ovs agent restart. What do you think?

- gate-cross-networking-midonet-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/51/447251/41/check/gate-cross-networking-midonet-python35/429c46f/ : SUCCESS in 10m 05s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-14 20:20:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 41:

(1 comment)

It's really queer but regardless of what I do no new flows on br-int. 
I created a firewall group with 1 ingress policy and 1 allow_icmp rule, booted a vm and attached vm's port to a firewall group via (openstack firewall group --set port PORT_ID) and no new flows appeared on br-int.
I have firewall_l2_driver = ovs in config and ovs-agent\neutron-server restarted."}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-16 04:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-16 09:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-16 09:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-16 14:45:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 41: Code-Review-1

Finally sorted out the issues with my environment and gave it a try.

The first more or less meaningful test I tried to run actually failed (http://paste.openstack.org/show/623738/ is a script to reproduce my test setup which requires just a fwaas_v2 + ovs driver devstack and correct path to openrc file specified in OPENRC variable at L12).

In short I created a security group with all allowed, a router, a private network (with interface added to the router), a firewall group with 1 ingress policy with icmp allowed and booted a vm. Verified that vm can be pinged from dhcp and router namespaces. After that I made vm's port to be managed by the firewall group (by firewall group set --port VM_PORT). Checked that flows appeared at br-int, then tried pinging the vm - no connectivity from neither of namespaces (router or dhcp). 

After unsetting port the vm could be reached again so I suppose the worst - we have an issue with openflow rules being generated and ovs-ofctl\ovs-appctl tools are our best friends now."}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-16 14:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

Hi folks,

As a requirement for co-existing between security group and firewall group: I’d like to propose a mechanism for case FW as below:
1. For ingress rules we have cases:
	1. There are fw_ingress_rules with action=ALLOW  —> “fw_ovs_driver will be inserted accept flows”
	2. There are fwg_ingress_rules with action=DENY or REJECT —>“fw_ovs_driver will be Inserted Drop flows’—>these packets never come to VM”
        3. There are no fwg rules But there may be have sg_rules —> “fw_ovs_driver should be resubmitted packets to SG table, so these packet will be processed by security group.(Note: currently implementation will drop these packets)
2. For egress rules we have cases:
	1. There are fw_egress_rules with action=ALLOW —> “fw_ovs_driver will be inserted accept flows”
	2. There are fw_egress_rules witch action=DENY or REJECT—> “fw_ovs_driver will be inserted drop flows” —> these packets never go out.
	3. There no fwg rules but there may be have sg_rules —> “fw_ovs_driver should be resubmitted packets to SG table, So these packets will be processed by security group” (Note: current implementation will drop these packets)

If you think that make sense, I will change current implementation a bit. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-16 15:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

annp, isn't there an easier way to chain 2 pipelines without inspecting direction (ingress\egress) and action (allow\deny)? I thought that "all packets that make it to table X automatically are forwarded to neutron ovsfw driver pipeline" concept is possible.

But to be honest I would not do anything right now regarding interoperability with neutron's ovsfw driver because currently even less complicated stuff doesn't work out of the box (see my previous comment about failed test case).'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-16 15:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

@inessa, 
>isn't there an easier way to chain 2 pipelines without inspecting direction (ingress\egress) and action (allow\deny)?

Currently, I have only once above idea. I think it's quite simple idea, We can use action "resubmit" to forward  packets to tables, which we want. Do you think so?'}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-16 15:58:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 41:

annp, imo if you are planning to forward or not forward packets judging by direction and action this is a lot more complicated then introduce some TRANSIENT_LIKE_TABLE_FOR_FWAAS at the end of current fwaas pipeline and then resubmit all packets that make it there to neutron's ovsfw driver pipeline.

But again I would fix broken stuff first and then introduce any more openflow related logic. We'll have our personal debugging hell the next few days without neutron's ovsfw driver interoperability. There's already too much on the plate with no real test coverage."}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-16 16:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

@Inessa, ah, OK! lets make it run correctly first. :)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-17 07:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-17 08:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

(1 comment)

Hi Inessa,

Do you have any plan to update this patch for fixing your case? Or Can I update this patch?'}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-17 11:54:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 41:

(2 comments)

I don't think security groups with iptables_hybrid are subject to loss of connectivity in my test case (yes, I tried to disable security groups and rerun the test). 

So let's have fun debugging :)"}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-17 18:30:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 42.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-18 03:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41:

Hi inessa, 
The root cause of problem,we're missing fixed_ips in port_details. So we could generate enough flows when we using cmd openstack firewall group set... That's reason why you can ping if you restart agent or rest port."}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-18 14:29:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 42:

commit_message:
OVS based l2 Firewall driver for FWaaS v2

This driver is based on neutron ovsfw driver.
Current implementation forks neutron code from commit
917063a0ce3638dafb80f29da2b0c1f0c4165306

Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0
Change-Id: If89e29bac3bc4167c7caf602fb5e3133cc93255f

commit_message:
Add helper to wait until baremetal locks clear

Add a halper to allow the methods to wait until locks
have cleared before proceeding.

Change-Id: I36175cc570fec47484297fd7fc7b6aa7da466d9f

This patch removes an API change to expose supported power states from
the SPEC to support soft shutdown and NMI injection. This API change

commit_message:
Remove API change for supported power states

This patch removes an API change to expose supported power states from
the SPEC to support soft shutdown and NMI injection. This API change
will be discussed with another RFE.

Change-Id: Ibff36165b9e6dedeef16e98fed60d85213b6581c
Closes-Bug: 1526226
Related-Bug: 1734827

This reverts commit 41fcc401d8c20281086205e31e995ff1d98d7d02.

Original commit introduce problems with PXE and dnsmasq due to
buggy dnsmasq code which uses siaddr field to specify
tftp server and doesn't reply with tfp server address 150 option.
They are addressed now by always sending server-ip-address to make
sure that dnsmasq works.

More information about siaddr and option 150,66 can be found in
informational RFC https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5859

Change-Id: I55487d867979bf6bb4cf228fcf6408beae955d2b

commit_message:
Change pxe dhcp options name to codes.

There is difference between dhcp option names in different backends.
This patch changes options name to code according to [0].

[0] https://www.iana.org/assignments/bootp-dhcp-parameters/bootp-dhcp-parameters.xhtml

Closes-Bug: 1717236

This is an updated version of c377f5cbbd034e16b68a3fc30e138b03badc9c94
which problems with PXE and dnsmasq due to buggy dnsmasq code which uses
siaddr field to specify tftp server. They are addressed now by always
sending server-ip-address to make sure that dnsmasq works.

More information about siaddr and option 150,66 can be found in
informational RFC https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5859

Change-Id: I55487d867979bf6bb4cf228fcf6408beae955d2b

[{'created': '2017-11-01 09:49:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

Change-Id: I35fd27e9618dcc6e229267a9af215ca15a47db69
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

Change-Id: I35fd27e9618dcc6e229267a9af215ca15a47db69

commit_message:
Add requirements.txt for docs builds

Docs requirement some packages to be installed that are not currently
captured in the requirements.txt file. This causes job failures in the
post release jobs for oslo.db.

Adding doc/requirements.txt to list the two packages needed for docs
builds.

commit_message:
IPv6 healthcheck fixes for Glance/Swift

Add some checks and fixes for IPv6 bracket URLs for the
Glance and Swift healthchecks. Also, added the -g option
to our healthcheck command to disable the globing parser
(which is also required)

Change-Id: If6a1ee5a138d4c96a4ee01681f4189d96073efad
Closes-bug: 1735923

commit_message:
ironic: support enabling staging drivers

* add ironic::drivers::staging to enable use of staging drivers
  (disabled by default)
* remove mentions of SSH drivers (removed upstream, similar
  functionality is provided by staging drivers)

Implements: blueprint ovirt-driver
Change-Id: I89da8187c2c549ad2f6d569890080ce144be46c0
Depends-On: Ibef8f33f306b9d3b598698345ce3b0978f62a2ad

commit_message:
Adds Source Links to Reports

For the purpose of downstream release analysis it
is often helpful to carry the reference to the
yaml file for each release note. This allows for
the consumption of all release notes (upgrade,
deprecation, features, etc) for a given addition
if a consumer so chooses.

Change-Id: I204202704527203cfefdd3d0069f3a02f2186e96

suse and cent. This should help resolve network stability issues and
kernel traces we've been seeing in the gate.

Depends-On: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5

commit_message:
Disable offloading in test by default

We disable offloading in test for ubuntu this change does the same for
suse and cent. This should help resolve network stability issues and
kernel traces we've been seeing in the gate.

Depends-On: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Change-Id: I6e8eaf7a668f140c1de4f541a414d13caf7d8b61
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cbb97004477f68668dc16617dab17024c397fdfb)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ic2615a261e433ce7ec8c0ef1d9c2061286a05739

commit_message:
Add logs when receiving SIGHUP signal

daemon will reload its configuration files and reopen its logfiles
instead of exiting when receiving SIGHUP signal. So we need some
necessary logs about this event.

Change-Id: I365fd6f8602d6cfa9b91619648f97aeedecde08c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-13 18:02:32.000000000', 'message': 'Translate tripleo-ci logic of when to build images to ansible

In order to combine the tripleo-ci OVB playbook with what we have
here, we need to implement the logic around when to build images[1].

This change diverges slightly in that the logic in the to_build script
currently builds images even in updates jobs if a project is in the
list of projects which affects image building. The comments in that
script lead me to believe that is not actually the desired behavior
though. We want to skip image building in those jobs in all cases,
because they already have issues completing in the time alloted.

I also think if we added a periodic updates job in the promote pipeline,
the logic in the tripleo-ci to_build script would fail, because the job
would try to download an image that does not exist yet. This change also
fixes that, by unconditionally building images in the case of periodic
jobs.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/scripts/to_build

Change-Id: I72169d4c6ae891397916f831e56eb883d047c89b
'}, {'created': '2017-10-17 20:39:40.000000000', 'message': 'Translate tripleo-ci logic of when to build images to ansible

In order to combine the tripleo-ci OVB playbook with what we have
here, we need to implement the logic around when to build images[1].

This change diverges slightly in that the logic in the to_build script
currently builds images even in updates jobs if a project is in the
list of projects which affects image building. The comments in that
script lead me to believe that is not actually the desired behavior
though. We want to skip image building in those jobs in all cases,
because they already have issues completing in the time alloted.

I also think if we added a periodic updates job in the promote pipeline,
the logic in the tripleo-ci to_build script would fail, because the job
would try to download an image that does not exist yet. This change also
fixes that, by unconditionally building images in the case of periodic
jobs.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/scripts/to_build

Change-Id: I72169d4c6ae891397916f831e56eb883d047c89b
'}, {'created': '2017-10-19 20:40:03.000000000', 'message': 'Translate tripleo-ci logic of when to build images to ansible

In order to combine the tripleo-ci OVB playbook with what we have
here, we need to implement the logic around when to build images[1].

We default to fetching pre-built images. However, in the case we are testing
a change to a project that can affect the image build or the case we are
running a periodic job, we want to build the images.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/scripts/to_build

Change-Id: I72169d4c6ae891397916f831e56eb883d047c89b

Change-Id: I72169d4c6ae891397916f831e56eb883d047c89b

commit_message:
Translate tripleo-ci logic of when to build images to ansible

In order to combine the tripleo-ci OVB playbook with what we have
here, we need to implement the logic around when to build images[1].

We default to fetching pre-built images. However, in the case we are testing
a change to a project that can affect the image build or the case we are
running a periodic job, we want to build the images.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/master/scripts/to_build

Change-Id: I72169d4c6ae891397916f831e56eb883d047c89b

commit_message:
Fix SUSE gate overrides outside gates

When storing the nodepool information task into suse mirror, the
resulting variable could be storing ansible information, not only
stdout. That could lead to malformed urls for the variable, when
the check is skipped outside gates.

See the value of a repo, containing ``opensuse_mirror`` here:
"{'skipped': True,
  'skip_reason': 'Conditional result was False',
  'changed': False}/distribution/leap/42.3/repo/oss/"

Change-Id: Idfd3c233c2239b642154960b536abe1f7fca7942

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-04 00:34:59.000000000', 'message': "Add basic plugin support for nspawn type containers

This change modifies our connection plugins to allow us to use nspawn
type containers. The change will pull in the container_type variable and
set the padding dor commands accordingly. The module has been setup to
default to LXC which ensures we've no conflicts with existing
deployments.

Change-Id: I8877c244af6458ca9840ea0519ab457a726feefd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add basic plugin support for nspawn type containers

This change modifies our connection plugins to allow us to use nspawn
type containers. The change will pull in the container_type variable and
set the padding for commands accordingly.

While the module has been setup to default to LXC which ensures we've no
conflicts with existing deployments, the container_check function has been
set to ignore "nspawn" type containers until we have a suitable/reliable
method to connect to them without envoking ssh.

Change-Id: I8877c244af6458ca9840ea0519ab457a726feefd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Download Kafka from Apache Archives

Apache Kafka 0.9.0.1 is not available on mirrors any more.

Change-Id: I47e0a9d1718bd5268610b2183397dec22911947a
(cherry picked from commit I47e0a9d1718bd5268610b2183397dec22911947a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 00:42:02.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I6b0d10135522e155df15ae353352de00ccde1359
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I6b0d10135522e155df15ae353352de00ccde1359

commit_message:
Wire up keystone_memcached_servers

keystone_memcached_servers are now representing not only the
keystone hosts (where memcached was collocated for UUID tokens)
but also memcache hosts. This follows the same pattern as rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I7a06c9cff57270cea8b467a0e191737986c58d69

commit_message:
Wire up keystone_memcached_servers

keystone_memcached_servers are now representing not only the
keystone hosts (where memcached was collocated for UUID tokens)
but also memcache hosts. This follows the same pattern as rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I95d72db7bc28080cb4963988a11f003dc7578c24

- gate-openstack-ansible-os_keystone-ansible-uw_nginx-centos-7 http://logs.openstack.org/25/455625/1/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_keystone-ansible-uw_nginx-centos-7/9d53e53/ : SUCCESS in 24m 34s
- gate-openstack-ansible-os_keystone-ansible-uw_nginx-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/25/455625/1/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_keystone-ansible-uw_nginx-ubuntu-xenial/baad44f/ : SUCCESS in 24m 26s
- gate-openstack-ansible-os_keystone-ansible-upgrade-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/25/455625/1/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_keystone-ansible-upgrade-ubuntu-xenial/a819c6e/ : SUCCESS in 22m 52s'}, {'account_id': 21241, 'date': '2017-04-11 10:53:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Dolph Mathews in keystone.conf [cache] section I'm trying to put

[cache]
backend = dogpile.cache.memcached
backend_argument = url:10.77.103.151,10.77.103.135,10.77.103.69:11211
memcache_servers = 10.77.103.151:11211,10.77.103.135:11211,10.77.103.69:11211
config_prefix = cache.keystone
distributed_lock = True
enabled = true

but it doesn't show any connection to memcache servers when I'm doing netstat. So the question is what exactly configuration for memcache servers it should be? Because now I can make it working by remove backend_argument and put only memcache_servers configuration but I'm not sure that backend_argument be used somewhere else or not?"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2017-04-11 15:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-04-11 19:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Caching is still deployed by default though, right?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-04-12 10:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Caching is still deployed by default though, right?

This is the case, but I think it deserves more attention in the conditional. Let me think about it.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-04-12 10:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Caching is still deployed by default though, right?
 > 
 > This is the case, but I think it deserves more attention in the
 > conditional. Let me think about it.

Lance, Dolph, please keep in mind I have almost 0 knowledge of this :p

I think there is a cleanup to do. I'll do it if you confirm.

1) Currently we have "memcache" by default in the role in [token] driver=  (persistence token driver?).
According to the docs I'd have to move to "kvs" instead of "memcache" for non-fernet provider. (That's a detail)

2) If I move to "kvs" that would (still according to the docs) read the [kvs] section. Everything is deprecated there, so need to do anything more there. But then, wouldn't it be easier to have in role defaults something like "sql" instead? Or should we really have this kvs persistence driver? (The default provider is still fernet, remember). (That sounds a more important change, architectural defaults, therefore need for a release note).

3) According to keystone docs:
"Keystone’s configuration file offers two separate sections related to caching, [memcache] and [cache]. The [memcache] section provides caching options to configure memcache backends. For example, if your deployment issues UUID tokens ([token] provider = uuid) and your token storage driver is memcache ([token] driver = kvs), the configuration options in the [memcache] section will effect token storage behavior. 
"

So assuming we don't move to "sql" in the token driver, and keep kvs, I'd need the [memcache] section to configure memcache caching for token persistence. From what we configure right now, only "servers" are relevant, so I think I could safely remove the whole [memcache] section. (Like how I did in this commit).

However we have a subtlety here: The token persistence was stored on keystone nodes's memcached, while subsystem caching (for sql/ldap/anything) was done on memcached servers. So now, IF everything (token persistence and other caching using memcache) reads the same [cache] memcache_servers, we'll move the persistence tokens from keystone to outside keystone. I guess that would need a study.

4) I'm now concerned on what Jirayut said, the [cache] memcache_servers vs backend_arguments that historically hold dogpile.cache.memcached url. Should we continue to have this set? 

I'm a little confused now.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-04-12 11:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > > code on how this is done, to know what to configure.

 > It seems the way forward, oslo.cache handling things for us, and we
 > can then point to generic memcached instances. What's your opinion
 > on all this Dolph, Lance?

In my original comment, I was referring to the caching of data from within keystone so that the token creation and validation times for fernet remain reasonable. This is done by enabling caching for various subsystems in keystone [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]. All of those booleans only take affect when the global setting is true [7], which is within the oslo.cache section and is subject to changes within that section.

The collective result of caching individual sub-systems (i.e. identity, resource, catalog, etc) within keystone will keep token response times from skyrocketing depending on the amount of data in the deployment. If fernet is not the configured token provider, then using the memcache backend for token storage is an option, but was deprecated in Ocata [8] and has been removed in Pike.

Does this help?

 > > > >
 > > > > 3) According to keystone docs:
 > > > > "Keystone’s configuration file offers two separate sections
 > > > related
 > > > > to caching, [memcache] and [cache]. The [memcache] section
 > > > provides
 > > > > caching options to configure memcache backends. For example,
 > if
 > > > > your deployment issues UUID tokens ([token] provider = uuid)
 > > and
 > > > > your token storage driver is memcache ([token] driver = kvs),
 > > the
 > > > > configuration options in the [memcache] section will effect
 > > token
 > > > > storage behavior.
 > > > > "
 > > > >
 > > > > So assuming we don't move to "sql" in the token driver, and
 > > keep
 > > > > kvs, I'd need the [memcache] section to configure memcache
 > > > caching
 > > > > for token persistence. From what we configure right now, only
 > > > > "servers" are relevant, so I think I could safely remove the
 > > > whole
 > > > > [memcache] section. (Like how I did in this commit).
 > > > >
 > > > > However we have a subtlety here: The token persistence was
 > > stored
 > > > > on keystone nodes's memcached, while subsystem caching (for
 > > > > sql/ldap/anything) was done on memcached servers. So now, IF
 > > > > everything (token persistence and other caching using
 > memcache)
 > > > > reads the same [cache] memcache_servers, we'll move the
 > > > persistence
 > > > > tokens from keystone to outside keystone. I guess that would
 > > need
 > > > a
 > > > > study.
 > > > >
 > > > > 4) I'm now concerned on what Jirayut said, the [cache]
 > > > > memcache_servers vs backend_arguments that historically hold
 > > > > dogpile.cache.memcached url. Should we continue to have this
 > > set?
 > > > >
 > > > > I'm a little confused now.
 > > >
 > > > My recent understanding would be to remove all these and only
 > > keep
 > > > fernet forward, and therefore the [cache] would be the only way
 > > to
 > > > go, to cache all the subsystems. I'm having a look at the
 > > keystone
 > > > code on how this is done, to know what to configure.
 > >
 > > It seems the way forward, oslo.cache handling things for us, and
 > we
 > > can then point to generic memcached instances. What's your
 > opinion
 > > on all this Dolph, Lance?
 > 
 > In my original comment, I was referring to the caching of data from
 > within keystone so that the token creation and validation times for
 > fernet remain reasonable. This is done by enabling caching for
 > various subsystems in keystone [0] [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]. All of
 > those booleans only take affect when the global setting is true
 > [7], which is within the oslo.cache section and is subject to
 > changes within that section.
 > 
 > The collective result of caching individual sub-systems (i.e.
 > identity, resource, catalog, etc) within keystone will keep token
 > response times from skyrocketing depending on the amount of data in
 > the deployment. If fernet is not the configured token provider,
 > then using the memcache backend for token storage is an option, but
 > was deprecated in Ocata [8] and has been removed in Pike.
 > 
 > Does this help?
 > 
 > 
 > [0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L587
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L942
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L1062
 > [3] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L2436
 > [4] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L2498
 > [5] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L2520
 > [6] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L2844
 > [7] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/cf53f9a67acf39fcbf330b5819bed9d20c4cf31b/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L533
 > [8] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/ocata.html#deprecation-notes

This confirms my investigation.
I think we should now clear up any occurence of memcache for token persistence, and ensure memcache is properly used for all the rest, like you expressed.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-04-18 10:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-04-18 10:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I need to check how to do this properly, i.e: always use memcached by default on keystone nodes, and use another set of nodes (the memcached ones) when doing an integrated deploy.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-18 11:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Remove Memcached on keystone hosts (UUID caching)

This is done to prepare the removal of memcache servers for
UUID tokens in Q.

All the memcache servers in Q should now be configured in [cache] [1],
the option to configure the servers in [memcache] will be removed
in Q [2]. In the meantime, UUID token users should be warned of the
change.

By removing the deploy on keystone hosts of memcache components, we
make things clearer: Memcache hosts hold all the memcache caching.

At the same time, keystone_memcached_max_compare_and_set_retry
is not present in the keystone.conf.sample, so I removed it.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L543
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L1499-L1511

Change-Id: I9bf14643314f331fd032d2da7a2ddc01bbe52a0f
Related-Bug: 1681695
