commit_message:
Remove keystone_token_driver variable

The memcache token driver was removed in Ocata and the only valid option
is sql, which is only used when keystone_token_provider is uuid.

Change-Id: I1db15e2553893b74d3f7d57d4d50ca2052be04e4

[{'created': '2017-11-29 15:52:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove enable_{firewall,vpn} options

This patch removes the enable_firewall/enable_vpn options since
they were removed in Pike (deprecated since Juno). The FWaaS panel
is still enabled via the modern method (copying files into place).

The VPNaaS variable is no longer being used, so it is being removed.

Closes-Bug: 1735199
Change-Id: I7d42b2a857a7f0c9401becc68a152102fb702508
'}]
commit_message:
Remove enable_{firewall,vpn} options

This patch removes the enable_firewall/enable_vpn options since
they were removed in Pike (deprecated since Juno). The FWaaS panel
is still enabled via the modern method (copying files into place).

The VPNaaS variable is no longer being used, so it is being removed.

Closes-Bug: 1735199
Change-Id: I7d42b2a857a7f0c9401becc68a152102fb702508

commit_message:
Remove send_arp_for_ha option

The send_arp_for_ha option was removed in neutron's pike release
and neutron will automatically send three ARP requests for each
address on a port.

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron/pike.html

Closes-Bug: 1735215
Change-Id: I312820e1a7818cd20472052bf93e8d2f44d21816

commit_message:
Remove sleep option from service handlers

The systemd module doesn't support the sleep option and this patch
removes it from the handlers.

Closes-Bug: 1735786
Change-Id: Ida1d83903dc4d3cd85029735a0882bf342d21dca

[{'created': '2017-11-30 21:51:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix HA router initialization exception

When an HA router initialization fails early, it can lead to:

 AttributeError: 'HaRouter' object has no attribute 'process_monitor'

Add init of 'self.process_monitor' in RouterInfo init code in
case we try and cleanup early.

Change-Id: Iddeaeef13adee10f7b130e3f9e584b6e9f037030
Closes-bug: #1735557
"}]
commit_message:
Fix HA router initialization exception

When an HA router initialization fails early, it can lead to:

 AttributeError: 'HaRouter' object has no attribute 'process_monitor'

Add init of 'self.process_monitor' in RouterInfo init code in
case we try and cleanup early.

Change-Id: Iddeaeef13adee10f7b130e3f9e584b6e9f037030
Closes-bug: #1735557

whether they are containers or not.

[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515399
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515400/

Change-Id: Ic959a42f7c6fb33b80e646b6689fc2d54f4f9ac8
"}]
commit_message:
Adapt to openstack_hosts/pip_install changes

The commit [1] introduced a change in the openstack_hosts role,
allowing it to be aware of group_vars/host_vars.

We therefore don't need the group matching in the variable
``openstack_host_specific_kernel_modules``.

On top of that, the commit [2] allowed repo management for all
hosts where openstack_hosts is applied, and commit [3] removed
UCA from pip install, which applies to all the hosts,
whether they are containers or not.
We should therefore add UCA to containers back.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515397
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515399
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515400/

Change-Id: Ic959a42f7c6fb33b80e646b6689fc2d54f4f9ac8

subject: Fix DNS connectivity issues with DVR+HA routers and DHCP-HA
messages: [{'account_id': 748, 'date': '2017-12-02 03:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2017-12-02 03:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1733987-stable/pike to bug/1733987'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-02 18:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-04 13:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 03:09:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix DNS connectivity issues with DVR+HA routers and DHCP-HA

Before this change, DVR_SNAT agents would get no routers when
asking for updates due to provisioning of DHCP ports on the
node they are running on. This means that there's no connectivity
between the DHCP port and the network gateway (that may be
hosted on a different node), and therefore things like DNS may
break when a VM attempts resolution when talking to the affected
DHCP port.

This change relaxed a conditional that prevents the right list of
routers to be compiled and returned from the server to the agent.
The agent on the other hand needs to make sure to allocate the
right type of router based on what is being returned from the server.

Closes-bug: #1733987

Change-Id: I6124738c3324e0cc3f7998e3a541ff7547f2a8a7
(cherry picked from commit b24013f569024f71197370b10dd23a7647d22c73)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DNS connectivity issues with DVR+HA routers and DHCP-HA

Before this change, DVR_SNAT agents would get no routers when
asking for updates due to provisioning of DHCP ports on the
node they are running on. This means that there's no connectivity
between the DHCP port and the network gateway (that may be
hosted on a different node), and therefore things like DNS may
break when a VM attempts resolution when talking to the affected
DHCP port.

This change relaxed a conditional that prevents the right list of
routers to be compiled and returned from the server to the agent.
The agent on the other hand needs to make sure to allocate the
right type of router based on what is being returned from the server.

Closes-bug: #1733987

Change-Id: I6124738c3324e0cc3f7998e3a541ff7547f2a8a7
(cherry picked from commit b24013f569024f71197370b10dd23a7647d22c73)

subject: Design for full sync and recovery of resources
messages:
[{'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-16 08:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2017-11-16 11:27:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'd rather have a DriverBase that defines the default methods for fullsync and recovery plus a __init__ that registers itself with the resource_syncer. Then the networking-odl driver would have a multiple inheritance of both the driver specific base and this base. 

class DriverBase(object):

    RESOURCES_HANDLED = []

    def __init__(self):
        resource_syncer.register(self, self.RESOURCES_HANDLED)

    def _full_sync(self, ...):
        <default_behavior_for_fullsync>

    def _recovery(self, ...):
        <default_behavior_for_recovery>



and then for example the BGPVPN driver could do

class BGPVPNDriver(bgpvpn.DriverBase, DriverBase):
    def __init__(self, ...):
        super(BGPVPNDriver, self).__init__(self, ...)

    def _recovery(self, ...):
        <just_modify_the_default_recovery_behavior>



I hope it's clear"}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-11-16 12:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> I'd rather have a DriverBase that defines the default methods for
 > fullsync and recovery plus a __init__ that registers itself with
 > the resource_syncer. Then the networking-odl driver would have a
 > multiple inheritance of both the driver specific base and this
 > base.

+1 with the exception of the method names and what they do.
I think it's important to separate the logic of "full sync" and "recovery" from "how to fetch a resource(s) from the plugin".

 > 
 > class DriverBase(object):
 > 
 > RESOURCES_HANDLED = []
 > 
 > def __init__(self):
 > resource_syncer.register(self, self.RESOURCES_HANDLED)
 > 
 > def _full_sync(self, ...):
 > <default_behavior_for_fullsync>

def get_resources(self, resource_type)

 > 
 > def _recovery(self, ...):
 > <default_behavior_for_recovery>

def get_resource(self, resource_type, resource_id)

 > 
 > 
 > 
 > and then for example the BGPVPN driver could do
 > 
 > class BGPVPNDriver(bgpvpn.DriverBase, DriverBase):
 > def __init__(self, ...):
 > super(BGPVPNDriver, self).__init__(self, ...)
 > 
 > def _recovery(self, ...):
 > <just_modify_the_default_recovery_behavior>
 > 
 > 
 > 
 > I hope it's clear'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-11-16 12:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-16 13:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> I'd rather have a DriverBase that defines the default methods for fullsync and recovery plus a __init__ that registers itself with the resource_syncer. Then the networking-odl driver would have a multiple inheritance of both the driver specific base and this base.

I don't agree with class name as well. This class is more specific to full sync and recovery of resources and deals mostly fetching resources.

>  I think it's important to separate the logic of "full sync" and "recovery" from "how to fetch a resource(s) from the plugin".

Making separate class for full sync and recovery to dealing with both the mechanism and base class works as fetching mechanism and deals with plugins.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2017-11-16 15:31:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > I'd rather have a DriverBase that defines the default methods for
 > fullsync and recovery plus a __init__ that registers itself with
 > the resource_syncer. Then the networking-odl driver would have a
 > multiple inheritance of both the driver specific base and this
 > base.
 > 
 > I don't agree with class name as well. This class is more specific
 > to full sync and recovery of resources and deals mostly fetching
 > resources.

Me neither, the naming was just to exemplify the idea."}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-21 10:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2017-11-21 10:58:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Direction seems much better now, some small issues remain which Iv'e commented on."}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2017-11-21 11:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-11-21 22:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Full sync and recovery is done through maintenance task. Methods
specific to recovery and full sync of a driver is defined in the
driver itself, but default methods are available corresponding
module for full sync and recovery.

This patch defines default methods through base class
and provides a way, to define driver specific methods for full sync
and recovery.

which closely binds methods specific to them.

commit_message:
Design for full sync and recovery of resources

Full sync and recovery is done through maintenance task. Methods
specific to recovery and full sync of a driver is defined in the
driver itself, but default methods are available corresponding
module for full sync and recovery.

This patch defines default methods through base class
and provides a way, to define driver specific methods for full sync
and recovery.

Change-Id: Ibc70dd758b12d09cc29a9c13d60fc27c8254189d
Partial-Closes: #1713697

commit_message:
Fix launch instance failed in trove

- remove useless *_url, which can be auto discovery
- use internalURL instead of publicURL which make it works when
  using self-signed SSL certification.
- configure network_driver to Neutron
- add network_label_regex to match all network name

Change-Id: I5654dbf391db7076c82aede5c2a4f8b7530b8381
Closes-Bug: #1734039

[{'created': '2017-12-01 16:36:09.000000000', 'message': 'Update the driver documentation for the undercloud

This change updates the wording to use "hardware types", which is our
primary notion right now. A difference between hardware types and classic
drivers is mentioned, and a few helpful links are added.

Add the full list of (techinically) supported drivers, and link to their
documentation pages. Stop "recommeding" vendor drivers, as they often have
problems that the IPMI driver does not have, and make it clear that these
drivers are not supported by the TripleO team (incl. its ironic part).

Change-Id: I8b2b307c9dd0d3d53e2ab791184128628c72c43c
Related-Bug: #1690185

commit_message:
Update the driver documentation for the undercloud

This change updates the wording to use "hardware types", which is our
primary notion right now. A difference between hardware types and classic
drivers is mentioned, and a few helpful links are added.

Add the full list of (techinically) supported drivers, and link to their
documentation pages. Stop "recommeding" vendor drivers, as they often have
problems that the IPMI driver does not have, and make it clear that these
drivers are not supported by the TripleO team (incl. its ironic part).

Change-Id: I8b2b307c9dd0d3d53e2ab791184128628c72c43c
Related-Bug: #1690185

[{'created': '2017-11-29 13:10:50.000000000', 'message': "Do not use own function to find migration target

The nova scenarios BootServerAttachCreatedVolumeAndLiveMigrate,
BootServerFromVolumeAndLiveMigrate, BootAndLiveMigrateServer are using
rally's own function to find a suitable target compute host for live
migration.
This function does not support all filters that are available and
configured in nova. This function only filters computes on AZ level.
For example it completely ignores flavor-aggregate mappings
(AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter). This leads to wrong target host
selection and thus a failing live migration.
This patch removes the function _find_host_to_migrate and the argument
target_host that was given into the function _live_migrate.
This leaves the target host selection completely up to nova,
for live migration, which allows to benefit from the whole nova
scheduler filters implementation, to find a suitable host.

Change-Id: Ide64667a5e482b10b8935e9ebd7655c0004c6a0b
Closes-Bug: #1734914
"}, {'created': '2017-12-04 09:11:08.000000000', 'message': "Do not use own function to find migration target

This patch removes the function _find_host_to_migrate and the argument
target_host that was given into the function _live_migrate.
This leaves the target host selection completely up to nova,

commit_message:
Do not use own function to find migration target

The nova scenarios BootServerAttachCreatedVolumeAndLiveMigrate,
BootServerFromVolumeAndLiveMigrate, BootAndLiveMigrateServer are using
rally's own function to find a suitable target compute host for live
migration.
This function does not support all filters that are available and
configured in nova. This function only filters computes on AZ level.
For example it completely ignores flavor-aggregate mappings
(AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter). This leads to wrong target host
selection and thus a failing live migration.
This patch removes the function _find_host_to_migrate and the argument
target_host that was given into the function _live_migrate.
This leaves the target host selection completely up to nova,
for live migration, which allows to benefit from the whole nova
scheduler filters implementation, to find a suitable host.

Change-Id: Ide64667a5e482b10b8935e9ebd7655c0004c6a0b
Closes-Bug: #1734914

commit_message:
Remove deprecrated [rbac] config group

This PS removes the deprecated [rbac] config group. It was replaced
last release cycle with the [patrole] config group, which has
the exact same options. This is because [patrole] is more user-friendly
and congruent with the project name.

Change-Id: Id1a7af0445bd50f44ddcc4277f952391968726b8

commit_message:
Allow the upstream pypi mirror to be changed

Currently the upstream pypi mirror is hard set to
pypi, but sometimes it is preferred to use a different
mirror. This allows the upstream mirror to be changed.

Change-Id: Icd93c0c801bfee1b4fdc8154d078067722c0640a
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Remove tempest-lib

This is deprecated for some time already and newer oslotest causes
it to fail to build, so we need to drop it in order to move on

Change-Id: Ie48b36457c09ff908fd42382cc0f1b7f620a16da

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-18 10:18:59.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor Register nodes dialog to use redux-form

* RegisterNodesDialog now connects to registerNodesForm and uses selectors
  action creators to access form state
* RegisterNodesForm uses redux-form and lists node forms as fieldArray
* Adds Horizontal field components to use with redux-form
* Uploading nodes from file is extracted into separate component
* Uses redux-form-validators to provide validations for fields
* Updates DriverFields components to be used with redux-form
* Adds Fieldset component
* Changes nodes registration logic:
  * Function for handling form submit replaces thunk action to simplify
    work with redux-form as it can return Promise which redux-form expects
  * validateNodes Mistral action is called explicitly to act as a standalone
    server side validation
  * When register nodes workflow successfully starts, form is reset and app
    redirects to nodes page where registration continues
  * Logic is prepared to work on individual nodes which will be introduced in
    subsequent patch

Implements: blueprint ui-redux-form-migration
Change-Id: I2d64f95bfbde47b89824a102fa51034db5869cdd
'}, {'created': '2017-09-18 10:32:38.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor Register nodes dialog to use redux-form

  * Logic is prepared to work on individual nodes which will be introduced in
    subsequent patch

Implements: blueprint ui-redux-form-migration
Change-Id: I2d64f95bfbde47b89824a102fa51034db5869cdd
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor Register nodes dialog to use redux-form

* RegisterNodesDialog now connects to registerNodesForm and uses selectors
  action creators to access form state
* RegisterNodesForm uses redux-form and lists node forms as fieldArray
* Adds Horizontal field components to use with redux-form
* Uploading nodes from file is extracted into separate component
* Uses redux-form-validators to provide validations for fields
* Updates DriverFields components to be used with redux-form
* Adds Fieldset component
* Changes nodes registration logic:
  * Function for handling form submit replaces thunk action to simplify
    work with redux-form as it can return Promise which redux-form expects
  * validateNodes Mistral action is called explicitly to act as a standalone
    server side validation
  * When register nodes workflow successfully starts, form is reset and app
    redirects to nodes page where registration continues
  * Logic is prepared to work on individual nodes which will be introduced in
    subsequent patch

Implements: blueprint ui-redux-form-migration
Change-Id: I2d64f95bfbde47b89824a102fa51034db5869cdd

"}, {'created': '2016-11-09 14:18:05.000000000', 'message': "Add new roles to feature matrix

Add 'primary_keystone' and 'subnode_keystone' roles to feature matrix.
This roles would be useful for Keystone multinode grenade job as we need
multi-Keystone openstack installation. We need to have a controller and
one Keystone node which only has a Keystone service running.

Environment variable MULTI_KEYSTONE is responsible for activating these roles.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I577eb46b82bef54f89eed5c8a43a472341ff17a6
"}, {'created': '2016-11-11 12:56:24.000000000', 'message': "Add new roles to feature matrix

Add 'primary_keystone' and 'subnode_keystone' roles to feature matrix.
This roles would be useful for Keystone multinode grenade job as we need
multi-Keystone openstack installation. We need to have a controller and
one Keystone node which only has a Keystone service running.

Environment variable MULTI_KEYSTONE is responsible for activating these roles.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I577eb46b82bef54f89eed5c8a43a472341ff17a6
"}, {'created': '2016-11-15 08:06:50.000000000', 'message': "Add new roles to feature matrix

Add 'primary_keystone' and 'subnode_keystone' roles to feature matrix.
This roles would be useful for Keystone multinode grenade job as we need

commit_message:
Add MULTI_KEYSTONE flag and new role

Add 'subnode_keystone' role to feature matrix.
This role would be useful for Keystone multinode grenade job as we need
multi-Keystone openstack installation. We need to have a controller and
one Keystone node which only has a Keystone service running.

Environment variable MULTI_KEYSTONE is responsible for activating this role.

Set "RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB=False" to subnode localrc in case of MULTI_KEYSTONE
is set to 1.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I577eb46b82bef54f89eed5c8a43a472341ff17a6

commit_message:
Force the uca filename

Defining staticly the UCA filename allows us to know in advance
which file to copy from host in the lxc_host role.

We remove here previously defined or default UCA filenames for
the same branch.

Change-Id: If6e3fe6b6c24570c34fe7bab358aed59340f379c

commit_message:
Set DNS on ctlplane network

This is useful if some of the NIC configs are no-op but we still want
DNS available on *all* overcloud nodes.

Change-Id: I83017b0598ce2321c99fe1bcc142c9127a932a48

commit_message:
Prepare containers with openstack-hosts role

The commit [1] allowed repo management for all
hosts where openstack_hosts is applied, and commit [2] removed
UCA from pip install, which applies to all the hosts,
whether they are containers or not.
We should therefore add UCA to containers back.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515399
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515400

Change-Id: I79ff70c438b44753be2a93f004ebbc46de0a963d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 10:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ImportError in single_tenant_remote

We have to use novaclient.client instead of novaclient.v1_1.client that
was removed in mitaka [1]. Also parameters of functions are modified to
be compatible to trove.common.remote.*_client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240241/

Change-Id: I0f46c56e7694977725ae79f9949ee0062921048e
Closes-Bug: #1662300
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ImportError in single_tenant_remote

We have to use novaclient.client instead of novaclient.v1_1.client that
was removed in mitaka [1]. Also parameters of functions are modified to
be compatible to trove.common.remote.*_client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240241/

Change-Id: I0f46c56e7694977725ae79f9949ee0062921048e
Closes-Bug: #1662300

Switch to using items for dictionary iteration.

Change-Id: I5cd7e445e385dd23d5187ef251d8416bdd3db7d4

commit_message:
py3: Fix use of iteritems in templates

Switch to using items for all dictionary iteration.

Change-Id: I465d0b53c3ff2eeb114b4a7f68ff6b124cb6362b
Closes-Bug: 1735797

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [cinder]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before stopping it.

Change-Id: I3d0b68eaf11b78f3422e026710d062f7e9455508
Partial-Bug: #1704389

commit_message:
Fix playbooks

Rename playbooks to use the same name as zuul.yaml uses.

Let's use .yaml here since that's the same filename as used in
openstack-zuul-jobs where the files were imported from.

Change-Id: I70f15ef75e9cb430fd94430efb1edb4b678384ae

commit_message:
Add ansible-lint script

This patch adds tools/ansible-lint.sh script to lint validations playbooks.
Moreover, it adds `changed_when: False` to commands that should not change
things if nothing needs doing [ANSIBLE0012].

Change-Id: I4fb432bfbd2b73740c29011d08a09058b6c45348
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove old fact cleanup tasks

The old fact and fact file were removed in the initial release of Pike
so these tasks shouldn't be necessary in upgrades to or new deployments
of Queens.

Change-Id: Id1e725e21c93f5b0efa734b2cddb6b22423d983a

messages:

The additional proposed options (there are two that I've mentioned) in PS1 should be recorded, even if it's not your final proposal."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-17 14:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-17 14:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-17 14:09:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The additional proposed options (there are two that I've mentioned)
 > in PS1 should be recorded, even if it's not your final proposal.

Done. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-17 14:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-21 14:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I lean towards Jesse's sentiment on this spec, too. I'd like to keep the openstack_hosts role specific to physical (metal) servers and get more creative about how we manage our containers. This will be important as we move to thinner and thinner container deployment strategies, like systemd-nspawn."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-22 09:19:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I lean towards Jesse's sentiment on this spec, too. I'd like to
 > keep the openstack_hosts role specific to physical (metal) servers
 > and get more creative about how we manage our containers. This will
 > be important as we move to thinner and thinner container deployment
 > strategies, like systemd-nspawn.

This isn't opposite to the way we manage our containers. If we move to systemd nspawn, this would make the task easier, by not doing anything at all.
On top of that it seems you are forgetting the all on metal use case, and all it takes to get there. 

This is a short route, while not opposed to the long route Jesse's proposing.

In the past we've been complaining not having a role that can be used accross the board, not only for repo management configuration too.

I fail to see ANY negative point of this spec."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-22 10:54:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Personally I am fine with the current proposal. The alternative approach is also interesting but it feels to me that it belongs in a different scope eg optimizing container creation etc. I see 'repo management' and 'container optimizations' as two different things so I don't think that both should be managed in this spec."}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-27 14:06:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

> This isn't opposite to the way we manage our containers. If we move
 > to systemd nspawn, this would make the task easier, by not doing
 > anything at all.

Okay, I see your point. I can support this as it stands right now."}, {'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2017-11-28 07:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-04 11:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Given that this is being implented, the spec should be merged as a record of the reasons.'}]

commit_message:
Simplify repo management

When fully running on bare metal, the current process of
deployment highlights some inefficiencies. This explains the
problem and a proposition on how to fix it.

Change-Id: Ia0ca51f8d18297bd1726429795af648f125d56c5

commit_message:
Limit resource consumption of function

Usages of following resources are limited(for at least python runtime):
- cpu
- process number
- file descriptor
- file size

Change-Id: I3bbd9e7a46a970eb0d9e99d1258b7b27407c0d90
Implements: blueprint qinling-container-resource-limitation

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ie31ac45bd9cdb6719d1019deeb87cd401e4b96f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 09:12:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I7e2cbab2f53af249822ec510b5c71e910e881da2
"}, {'created': '2017-11-17 09:46:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Also, use openstackdocstheme for releasenotes.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I7e2cbab2f53af249822ec510b5c71e910e881da2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Also, use openstackdocstheme for releasenotes.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I7e2cbab2f53af249822ec510b5c71e910e881da2

commit_message:
Return the right Content-Length when given a Content-Range

Currently, we always return the whole image size as Content-Length even when
asked for a small chunk.

Change-Id: Ic570e12be4d0aca612ffcd00e8466a9150d4ea2d
Closes-Bug: #1618928

When the user gives a folder to the lookup, it's expected to work,
whatever the content of the folder is.

In the Zuul v3 case, we are symlinking the role that are checked
out as part of the Zuul dependency resolution, for example when
Depends-On is used.

If we don't follow symlinks, those checkout roles aren't part

Change-Id: Ic09f6a9ee28e3f7919226f22b803ee1a1b8ad53d

commit_message:
Follow symlinks in the lookup

When the user gives a folder to the lookup, it's expected to work,
whatever the content of the folder is.

In the Zuul v3 case, we are symlinking the role that are checked
out as part of the Zuul dependency resolution, for example when
Depends-On is used.

If we don't follow symlinks, those checkout roles aren't part
of the repo build process, and won't be build.

Change-Id: Ic09f6a9ee28e3f7919226f22b803ee1a1b8ad53d
(cherry picked from commit 6d976477df3f2e6994079dca56d48e181ede7ebb)

commit_message:
Tempest plugin support for delayed queues

This patch is mainly to deal with the tempest plugin for delayed queue.
The delay queue added the `_default_message_delay` attribute, so tempest
plugin also add this attribute-related tests.

Change-Id: Ibea711ebb7377bba497db53c64a216c889cd0ee8
Implement: blueprint delayed-queues

commit_message:
Follow symlinks in the lookup

When the user gives a folder to the lookup, it's expected to work,
whatever the content of the folder is.

In the Zuul v3 case, we are symlinking the role that are checked
out as part of the Zuul dependency resolution, for example when
Depends-On is used.

If we don't follow symlinks, those checkout roles aren't part
of the repo build process, and won't be build.

Change-Id: Ic09f6a9ee28e3f7919226f22b803ee1a1b8ad53d
(cherry picked from commit 6d976477df3f2e6994079dca56d48e181ede7ebb)

commit_message:
Follow symlinks in the lookup

When the user gives a folder to the lookup, it's expected to work,
whatever the content of the folder is.

In the Zuul v3 case, we are symlinking the role that are checked
out as part of the Zuul dependency resolution, for example when
Depends-On is used.

If we don't follow symlinks, those checkout roles aren't part
of the repo build process, and won't be build.

Change-Id: Ic09f6a9ee28e3f7919226f22b803ee1a1b8ad53d
(cherry picked from commit 6d976477df3f2e6994079dca56d48e181ede7ebb)

subject: Update default settings in libvirtd.conf jinja template
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 05:37:05.000000000', 'message': "Update default settings in libvirtd.conf jinja template

Existing defaults are setup for tcp, and set ca_file to an empty string.
'If you set this to an empty string, then no trusted CA certificate is loaded.'

libvirt may complain 'unsupported configuration: No server certificate path
set to match server key', as such tls should also be explicitly set to 0.

Backport from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492552/

Closes-Bug: #1733806

Jira: ENTWLS-475

Change-Id: Ie4454ed7987672e10b674cbb66aa559dabb1183a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Update default settings in libvirtd.conf jinja template

Existing defaults are setup for tcp, and set ca_file to an empty string.
'If you set this to an empty string, then no trusted CA certificate is loaded.'

libvirt may complain 'unsupported configuration: No server certificate path
set to match server key', as such tls should also be explicitly set to 0.

Backport from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492552/

Closes-Bug: #1733806

Jira: ENTWLS-475

Change-Id: Ie4454ed7987672e10b674cbb66aa559dabb1183a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

subject: Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 06:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 17:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-12-04 09:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 06:23:05.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Icd931f97b8a11c9aa07ff7eecf2616ed4eacf420

commit_message:
Follow symlinks in the lookup

When the user gives a folder to the lookup, it's expected to work,
whatever the content of the folder is.

In the Zuul v3 case, we are symlinking the role that are checked
out as part of the Zuul dependency resolution, for example when
Depends-On is used.

If we don't follow symlinks, those checkout roles aren't part
of the repo build process, and won't be build.

Change-Id: Ic09f6a9ee28e3f7919226f22b803ee1a1b8ad53d

Only the nodes that run pacemaker (and the VIPs) should do whack
--listen. This is not something the computes should do as it will
restart the SAs.

Change-Id: Id295d18fe8caec3446f57bf9a99ccd301f8d2728
'}]
commit_message:
Only do force listen on pacemaker nodes

Only the nodes that run pacemaker (and the VIPs) should do whack
--listen. This is not something the computes should do as it will
restart the SAs.

Change-Id: Id295d18fe8caec3446f57bf9a99ccd301f8d2728

In multinode it is not required to install Ansible in each node.
Remove the "local_action" when check the Swift ring files in all
Swift nodes.

Closes-BUG: #1735591

Change-Id: Idd068e1cc7be18f079b0523b885f7b13fb5af443
Signed-off-by: Tone Zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

commit_message:
Fix the failure in Swift ring files "prechecks"

In multinode it is not required to install Ansible in each node.
Remove the "local_action" when check the Swift ring files in all
Swift nodes.

Closes-BUG: #1735591

Change-Id: Idd068e1cc7be18f079b0523b885f7b13fb5af443
Signed-off-by: Tone Zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

In order to help diagnose issues when we need
to, we collect the /etc folder from the host
and containers. We tarball them to prevent the
previous issues caused in OpenStack-Infra where
these files used up far too many inodes on the
log storage hosts and caused a big disruption.

Change-Id: I1687cbeaa64785c3b3fb952f85343bb640984b07
'}, {'created': '2017-11-24 16:06:27.000000000', 'message': 'Collect /etc files from the host and containers

and containers. We tarball them to prevent the

commit_message:
Collect /etc files from the host and containers

In order to help diagnose issues when we need
to, we collect the /etc folder from the host
and containers. We tarball them to prevent the
previous issues caused in OpenStack-Infra where
these files used up far too many inodes on the
log storage hosts and caused a big disruption.

Change-Id: I1687cbeaa64785c3b3fb952f85343bb640984b07

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-16 13:04:47.000000000', 'message': "Enable eventlet monkey patching for MySQLdb driver

Using MySQLdb driver for MySQL is not compatible with
greenthreads provided by eventlet library. If we issue
an SQL query through it from within a green thread then
eventlet dispatches doesn't switch to another green
thread although it is an IO operation.

We need to apply monkey patching to MySQLdb explicitly
as it was fixed some time ago but doesn't apply by default.

Change-Id: I7026f9811f9c4f1e0254d17f7aaef579932f0669
Closes-bug: #1723941
"}, {'created': '2017-11-20 05:53:49.000000000', 'message': "Enable eventlet monkey patching for MySQLdb driver

Using MySQLdb driver for MySQL is not compatible with
greenthreads provided by eventlet library. If we issue
an SQL query through it from within a green thread then
eventlet dispatches doesn't switch to another green
thread although it is an IO operation.

We need to apply monkey patching to MySQLdb explicitly
as it was fixed some time ago but doesn't apply by default.

Change-Id: I7026f9811f9c4f1e0254d17f7aaef579932f0669
Closes-bug: #1723941
"}, {'created': '2017-12-04 03:28:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix releasenotes job is failure

commit_message:
rabbitmq: don't wait for message ack/requeue

I don't see any obvious reason why we should wait ack/requeue is done.

This waiter have already be removed from amqp1.

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.messaging/tree/oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/controller.py#n242

So, this change remove it from rabbitmq driver too.

Closes-bug: #1734788

Change-Id: I5ecedc762596181be19410b863851a0054fd6579
(cherry picked from commit c38857e1101027a734a35f4e80bc4084fabc034b)

commit_message:
use addClassResourceCleanup in test_roles

Replaces resource_cleanup with addClassResourceCleanup in
test_roles.

test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc is NOT used in resource_setup
as delete_role_from_user_on_project and similar calls, do not delete
the role, it just unassigns the role from the target.

Change-Id: I5930c5f9d68b0258620e6de90398b34f84e06d9f

commit_message:
Fix debian IPA build

IPA recently started requiring  hexdump to be present
inside the ramdisk image.

While a catch has been proposed, this is a likely
cause of current master branch CI failures of bifrost.

Change-Id: I946582087855e0e2fc26767126f0f87500658c69

commit_message:
Make tinyipa and tinyipa-opensuse-423 work for other repos

This is a VERY tiny change to just make these two jobs work when
triggered from the shade repo. The larger fix is to rework all of the
integration jobs to use the new devstack base job ... but wow that'll be
more work than I feel lke doing on a Sunday morning.

Change-Id: Ic192bd6b5fa16726d6c03e83e752bc8beee81720

commit_message:
Clean up zuul files

Changes to legacy-bifrost-jobs.yaml:
- creates two jobs:
  - bifrost-base
  - bifrost-integration
- adds 'irrelevant-files' section to bifrost-base (from project.yaml)
  as well as additional irrelevant files

Changes to project.yaml:
- moves 'irrelevant-files' section to legacy-bifrost-jobs.yaml
- removes experimental section since the job is voting
- sorts the jobs list; voting first, alphabetical; non-voting second

Conflicts:
  zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: I514e7e40ecb95580a47922b253d8046cfcd1634c
(cherry picked from commit 12e6570bba850c83dd0b081cd24cb75d8d3247d9)

[{'created': '2017-12-02 15:23:16.000000000', 'message': "Remove file rule on tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq

The file rule for tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq
isn't safe because if a patch doesn't touch the featureset but something
else that can break OVB, we'll never know about the failure since the
job won't be run. This patch revert the file rule and run ovb job all
the time.
Change-Id: I58a81b94c10de7864d200f341f990001bb2730a6
"}, {'created': '2017-12-03 16:10:16.000000000', 'message': "Remove file rule on tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq

The file rule for tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq
isn't safe because if a patch doesn't touch the featureset but something
else that can break OVB, we'll never know about the failure since the
job won't be run. This patch revert the file rule and run ovb job all
the time.
Change-Id: I58a81b94c10de7864d200f341f990001bb2730a6
"}]
commit_message:
Remove file rule on tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq

The file rule for tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq
isn't safe because if a patch doesn't touch the featureset but something
else that can break OVB, we'll never know about the failure since the
job won't be run. This patch revert the file rule and run ovb job all
the time.
Change-Id: I58a81b94c10de7864d200f341f990001bb2730a6

commit_message:
Make time trigger scheduling strategy configurable

Currently, karbor use the multi node scheduling strategy
instead of the original single node scheduling strategy.
It's better to keep the two scheduling strategies in code
and make scheduling strategy configurable, so that users
can choose which one to use.

Change-Id: I13693da334041b58745040a1cbda1007e3cc2853
Implements: blueprint make-time-trigger-scheduling-strategy-configurable

[{'created': '2017-12-04 05:56:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix role name in test playbook

It was referencing the old playbook's role name.

Change-Id: I89a42b72be08a1171e2c1dc7b7c0a14caad8d634
"}, {'created': '2017-12-04 06:25:07.000000000', 'message': 'WORKAROUND: Set rolename to what legacy lint job expects

It was referencing the old playbook's role name. And for some
reason, the legacy lint job installs the job in a directory called
"workspace", which is not ideal since it's what it uses as the role
name. So we set the role name as "workspace" to work around that until
we figure out how to configure that properly.

Change-Id: I89a42b72be08a1171e2c1dc7b7c0a14caad8d634
'}, {'created': '2017-12-04 06:37:45.000000000', 'message': 'WORKAROUND: Use include_tasks instead of calling role

It was referencing the old playbook's role name. And for some
reason, the legacy lint job installs the job in a directory called
"workspace", which is not ideal since it's what it uses as the role
name. So instead of using the actual role name, we call the task
directly.

Change-Id: I89a42b72be08a1171e2c1dc7b7c0a14caad8d634
'}, {'created': '2017-12-04 06:47:52.000000000', 'message': 'WORKAROUND: Use include_tasks instead of calling role

It was referencing the old playbook's role name. And for some
reason, the legacy lint job installs the job in a directory called
"workspace", which is not ideal since it's what it uses as the role
name. So instead of using the actual role name, we call the task

Note that it also fixes a trailing whitespace from the meta/mail.yml
file

Change-Id: I89a42b72be08a1171e2c1dc7b7c0a14caad8d634
'}]
commit_message:
WORKAROUND: Use include_tasks instead of calling role

It was referencing the old playbook's role name. And for some
reason, the legacy lint job installs the job in a directory called
"workspace", which is not ideal since it's what it uses as the role
name. So instead of using the actual role name, we call the task
directly.

Note that it also fixes a trailing whitespace from the meta/mail.yml
file

Change-Id: I89a42b72be08a1171e2c1dc7b7c0a14caad8d634

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Group types API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/group_types
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/group_types/{group_type_id}

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997

Change-Id: I7b0a59a9a5bab396edee86b1a64e4c0c569d904b

"}]
commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: Group types

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Group types API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/group_types
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/group_types/{group_type_id}

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997

Change-Id: I7b0a59a9a5bab396edee86b1a64e4c0c569d904b
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ie2b44aca39401b0128a0e5b228ab8bb020efe451

commit_message:
Deleted locale dir & Updated babel-django.cfg

To enable translate job correctly, deleted heat-dashboard/locale
directory and updated babel-django.cfg accordingly.
Also fixed tox.ini which included wrong commands for docs build.

Change-Id: Idb7996ded645a8bc8bcb3b7eb08c8754a8492873

subject: API micro-version support for multiple features
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-18 18:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-11-18 21:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2017-11-21 16:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-02 23:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2017-12-04 04:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-18 18:06:07.000000000', 'message': 'API micro-version support for multiple features

Previously horizon micro-version support only supports one feature,
but there is a case where we need to support more than one feature
using micro-versioning. For example, "instance_description" and
"auto_allocated_network" in the server create operation both require
micro-version. This case was not supported previously.

This commit changes get_microversion() function to take a feature list
and looks up a micro-version which supports all requested features.

A known limitation is that we need to re-call get_microversion() with
different feature(s) if no micro-version which satisfies all requested
features is found and we would like to look up a micro-version which
supports a subset of the requested features. Most features are expected
in recent API versions, so I believe this would be a minor limitation.

Change-Id: I46f1c7fa1ddcf1dfac93d921cffaf3aa5ac011a7
Related-Bug: #1690433
'}, {'created': '2017-11-18 21:28:49.000000000', 'message': 'API micro-version support for multiple features

Previously horizon micro-version support only supports one feature,
but there is a case where we need to support more than one feature
using micro-versioning. For example, "instance_description" and
"auto_allocated_network" in the server create operation both require
micro-version. This case was not supported previously.

This commit changes get_microversion() function to take a feature list
and looks up a micro-version which supports all requested features.

A known limitation is that we need to re-call get_microversion() with
different feature(s) if no micro-version which satisfies all requested
features is found and we would like to look up a micro-version which
supports a subset of the requested features. Most features are expected
in recent API versions, so I believe this would be a minor limitation.

Change-Id: I46f1c7fa1ddcf1dfac93d921cffaf3aa5ac011a7
Related-Bug: #1690433
'}, {'created': '2017-12-02 23:01:28.000000000', 'message': 'API micro-version support for multiple features

Previously horizon micro-version support only supports one feature,
but there is a case where we need to support more than one feature
using micro-versioning. For example, "instance_description" and
"auto_allocated_network" in the server create operation both require
micro-version. This case was not supported previously.

This commit changes get_microversion() function to take a feature list
and looks up a micro-version which supports all requested features.

A known limitation is that we need to re-call get_microversion() with
different feature(s) if no micro-version which satisfies all requested
features is found and we would like to look up a micro-version which
supports a subset of the requested features. Most features are expected
in recent API versions, so I believe this would be a minor limitation.

Change-Id: I46f1c7fa1ddcf1dfac93d921cffaf3aa5ac011a7
Related-Bug: #1690433
'}]
commit_message:
API micro-version support for multiple features

Previously horizon micro-version support only supports one feature,
but there is a case where we need to support more than one feature
using micro-versioning. For example, "instance_description" and
"auto_allocated_network" in the server create operation both require
micro-version. This case was not supported previously.

This commit changes get_microversion() function to take a feature list
and looks up a micro-version which supports all requested features.

A known limitation is that we need to re-call get_microversion() with
different feature(s) if no micro-version which satisfies all requested
features is found and we would like to look up a micro-version which
supports a subset of the requested features. Most features are expected
in recent API versions, so I believe this would be a minor limitation.

Change-Id: I46f1c7fa1ddcf1dfac93d921cffaf3aa5ac011a7
Related-Bug: #1690433

commit_message:
Replace jsonutils by common json package

Should remove oslo.serialization which only use at one test-case.
This change will help project do not depends this package,
and let's use the regular json attribute anyway.

Change-Id: I01af1e1b09fb9866acf54fc7a19aedfaab34a684

Looks good if we ignore the comma, but that's a nit :)"}, {'account_id': 23458, 'date': '2017-12-04 01:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 16:24:52.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup _add_router_ext_gw()

This patch is cleaning up the _add_router_ext_gw() method. After the
commit 8cc1330884f94c29d78b6bb42283ebf2f36e4ee5, all creation and update
of those resources will be done in a single transaction so, having a
try..except block around the helper functions to be able to call
_delete_router_ext_gw() doesn't work, because the commit() will be
invoked later. Plus, if something else fails on those helper methods the
whole transaction will be aborted and nothing will be created in the
first place.

Change-Id: Ic27fe8059dd851e2189642e08d639e50fdf3d787
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup _add_router_ext_gw()

This patch is cleaning up the _add_router_ext_gw() method. After the
commit 8cc1330884f94c29d78b6bb42283ebf2f36e4ee5, all creation and update
of those resources will be done in a single transaction so, having a
try..except block around the helper functions to be able to call
_delete_router_ext_gw() doesn't work, because the commit() will be
invoked later. Plus, if something else fails on those helper methods the
whole transaction will be aborted and nothing will be created in the
first place.

Change-Id: Ic27fe8059dd851e2189642e08d639e50fdf3d787

commit_message:
Only use stestr and tempest run in tempest tox jobs

Now that we're starting to unify everything on a single test runner we
should only be using either tempest run or stestr (which tempest run
will use internally in the near future). This commit changes the
coverage job to use stestr and removes the ostestr job as part of that
effort.

Change-Id: I5972346b8dbef4a57c733f85ceeeeca425bf263e

commit_message:
Split out heat own items from Horizon settings.

Heat relevant contents will be split out
from Horizon in Queens release.

After this splitting out, Heat-Dashboard must have
its own settings in Heat-Dashboard repository.

So this review request includes following.

- Create own settings under local_settings.d
- Add procedure for installing above settings.
- Fix installation procedure according to above changes.

Change-Id: I0b9a9907cb0c02aed70e7c1af3d9d07b0ddeffb6

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: Iff8fe66e0a7825ed7a6b0cecfdc1cd30bb0bde75

commit_message:
Add sql db model for container actions

Add sql container_actions and container_action_events tables
for recording container actions. One action may produce
mulitiple events. So using events table to record each events,
just like the Nova did.

Change-Id: I33326977ccd17b881fe1fdf02477c86f4248f9a1
Implements: blueprint container-actions-api

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I2a41e9c75dc58ea9a9b3ddeeee553cc14ee95c9b

commit_message:
Move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt

Put these in place as a setup for the new versions of the doc build
jobs. Keep using them from the normal dep list until the jobs are
changed.

While we're here, update the docs env to use sphinx-build instead of
python setup.py build_sphinx. Also add python2.7 to the docs env, since
I accidentally tried building it with my python3 tox and it blew up
substantially.

Change-Id: I0fcc50c4c396758e839c329ce786a6f609bb1342

Remove the dependency on the demoapp and just add it to the import
path so it is available to be imported. Copy the entry point settings
into the main cliff setup.cfg to ensure they are registered for the
doc build to find.

Change-Id: I390410bc5247e8b6c8d0a8fec8e7ecb223d8d6c1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
do not require installing demo app to build docs

Remove the dependency on the demoapp and just add it to the import
path so it is available to be imported. Copy the entry point settings
into the main cliff setup.cfg to ensure they are registered for the
doc build to find.

Change-Id: I390410bc5247e8b6c8d0a8fec8e7ecb223d8d6c1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

The default py27 job ignores the changes to *.rst files. this addition
makes more sense to include the validation we do to the specs in it.

Change-Id: I35203af7f7a5c44aaacb8c934f90c2275d957403

commit_message:
Add doc8 to pep8 check for nova-specs project

This patch adds a doc8 check of .rst files to the current pep8 check.
It includes fixes to the .rst files that didn't pass the check.

The default py27 job ignores the changes to *.rst files. this addition
makes more sense to include the validation we do to the specs in it.

Co-authored-By: Hoang Trung Hieu <hieuht@vn.fujitsu.com>

Depends-On: I4e13103fd85c455f71341906fd1d0e753193b891
Change-Id: I35203af7f7a5c44aaacb8c934f90c2275d957403

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ieec1e7c7a4ae9a89fb413e4aa5288396690ed538

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Id8d9c74c1fb522d68ca4c40baff1fba10e94b6cd

What about making two changes - one to add neutron where it's really needed, and one on top of it with the branches? Then we can easy discuss the branch set up..."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-10-17 11:38:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My mistake, I missed that we were using a custom tox jobs template, I've split the patch has you've suggested, adding neutron only on the custom jobs in one patch and adding the branch overrides in this one."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-10-17 11:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-19 10:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I read those and made the assumption that it worked like the old OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH variable in the CI, where if I want it to apply to everything I just set the one variable, and if I want to be more specific I could specify it for each project. Also it then means all my jobs have to override the whole list of required_projects including openstack/requirements etc that come from inherited parent jobs, where as specifying it using the global override while apply it to everything that it can be applied to including inherited projects.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-10-23 13:29:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Ensure checkout overrides are correctly set for networking-cisco

Networking-cisco is branchless and supports multiple versions of
OpenStack to make sure we don't break that support our master branch
runs tests against multiple version of OpenStack and we need to make
sure that the tests install the right version to test against.

Change-Id: I3f97648ed81a8849e26c1174318e8dd2aedc9d57

commit_message:
Added parameters to assign already present options in neutron.conf and lbaas_agent.ini

  Giving an opportunity for the users to assign
  already present options such as
  ovs_integration_bridge option in neutron.conf
  and ovs_use_veth in lbaas_agent.ini configuration files on overcloud.

Change-Id: I023e0476e574d5a4c13d66da390aa13016566058
(cherry picked from commit d06ba1f7a02336664999ec66719bb42a0d261f1a)

commit_message:
Added parameters to assign already present options in neutron.conf and lbaas_agent.ini

  Giving an opportunity for the users to assign
  already present options such as
  ovs_integration_bridge option in neutron.conf
  and ovs_use_veth in lbaas_agent.ini configuration files on overcloud.

Change-Id: I023e0476e574d5a4c13d66da390aa13016566058
(cherry picked from commit d06ba1f7a02336664999ec66719bb42a0d261f1a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-03 15:26:59.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Updated from generate-constraints"

This reverts commit eede395c43f65ead7a93d6a9a8d8ea9936712781.

Raising jsonpatch to 1.20 has broken glanceclient.  See
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524821/ for an example.

Note: I wasn't sure if the correct thing to do here was revert
the entire change, which includes version changes on some other
libraries, or just lower the jsonpatch version.  There's another
patch up that *only* changes the jsonpatch version if that's the
correct way to go: https://review.openstack.org/524987

Change-Id: Ia04c417107fcd2b3c070dc4e89e053395e7d4c4d
Closes-bug: #1736005
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Updated from generate-constraints"

This reverts commit eede395c43f65ead7a93d6a9a8d8ea9936712781.

Raising jsonpatch to 1.20 has broken glanceclient.  See
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524821/ for an example.

Note: I wasn't sure if the correct thing to do here was revert
the entire change, which includes version changes on some other
libraries, or just lower the jsonpatch version.  There's another
patch up that *only* changes the jsonpatch version if that's the
correct way to go: https://review.openstack.org/524987

Change-Id: Ia04c417107fcd2b3c070dc4e89e053395e7d4c4d
Closes-bug: #1736005

commit_message:
Use infra centos 7 beaker jobs

These jobs are different than the base puppet beaker rspec jobs because
they have different required projects. Port over to using the infra
specific jobs on infra projects so the correct required projects are
used.

Change-Id: I65835f64780ef344c00dc1d2d3b645e6c6d60529
Depends-On: I4b1455dcfbc2f242fd9028c23d78beea1841e44f

commit_message:
Bump required os-brick to 2.1.1

A new bug fix release os-brick 2.1.1 was cut recently to include an
encryptor fix that was supposed to be included in 2.1.0, which is
needed for a nova change.

Change-Id: I861177529550031a94a5f83d391e94d610192aa2

commit_message:
zuul: ignore functional jobs when patching tox/setup files

tox.ini and setup files are for python unit tests or pep. We don't need
to waste multinode or OVB jobs for the changes in these files.

Change-Id: I48fb0fa4351c44b4aa654856c4560351220a42e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-29 10:12:57.000000000', 'message': "Configure Ubuntu guest images to use system certificate store

Currently there is no way to provide SSL configuration for uploading backups to Swift.
This patch installs a systemd drop-in which sets an environment variable
understood by Requests library for Python. This way every HTTPS call done
by trove-guest service will use Ubuntu's system certificate store to validate
the server's certificate.
To add a certificate one can put it in /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/
(in PEM format and with .crt extension) and call update-ca-certificates command.

Change-Id: I0025e7c72fa2d863ae9540941956b1ab63bcc636

commit_message:
Configure guestagent on Ubuntu guest images to use CA certificates

Currently there is no way to provide SSL configuration for Trove, so it
fails e.g. when uploading backups to a secured Swift endpoint. This
patch sets an environment variable (REQUESTS_CA_BUNDLE [1]) understood
by Requests library for Python, so all HTTPS calls done by trove-guest
service will trust the provided CAs.

For Ubuntu Xenial and Fedora a systemd drop-in sets this environment
variable for trove-guest service, so it uses Ubuntu's/Fedora's system
certificate store to validate server certificates.

For Ubuntu Trusty the upstart script is modified to build and use a
bundle file from certificates in /usr/local/share/ca-certificates,
because Requests library doesn't support CA directories in such old
Python versions.

On Ubuntu systems the custom certificates are taken from
/usr/local/share/ca-certificates; please use PEM format, .crt extension
and call update-ca-certificates.

On Fedora systems custom certificates can be put in
/usr/share/pki/ca-trust-source/anchors; please use PEM format, .pem
extension and call update-ca-trust.

[1] http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/advanced/#ssl-cert-verification

Change-Id: I0025e7c72fa2d863ae9540941956b1ab63bcc636

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0a80865a8a18c49b4d883850488cc0c73fe1bfcd

a PPG with tap_enabled=False.

commit_message:
Added 'tap_enabled' parameter for Port-pair-group

Adding 'tap_enabled' parameters to port-pair-group.
If '--enable-tap' set to True, port pairs in port-pair-group will
be deployed as passive Tap service function.

Change-Id: I7267b7ce782f040d0951a3b522d183931debe818

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-k8s-glance

Add the role to deploy Glance under the tripleo group.  These roles will
be used to deploy these services on Kubernetes respectively.

commit_message:
Make infra beaker rspec job for centos 7 nodes

The infra beaker rspec jobs have different required projects than the
base beaker rspec jobs. Convert the centos 7 job for infra over to
include the infra required projects.

Change-Id: I4b1455dcfbc2f242fd9028c23d78beea1841e44f

commit_message:
Set disable:true for oci-machine-register

This is meant to help resolve an issue where systemd would stop
the docker service incorrectly. Often seeming to occur when a container
was in a restart state.

Change-Id: Ifb519f8ee7412ef486e709a19c1251a0f7e5d35e
Related-bug: #1733943
(cherry picked from commit e9bce747833af94ce71fe76921bd53cb5df07964)

commit_message:
Retire Packaging Deb project repos

This commit is part of a series to retire the Packaging Deb project.
Step 3 is to set the Gerrit ACLs for these repositories to
read-only, remove them from CI configuration and IRC bots (as in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project).

Change-Id: I05c9e4a37ecb1eefe1909be3cb5fa56ee10710ff

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 18:28:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-12-02 20:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-12-03 15:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 18:28:12.000000000', 'message': "Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I4270610053e3c541e57e2e539fbd56ffc1c266f0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I4270610053e3c541e57e2e539fbd56ffc1c266f0

commit_message:
Fix incorrect known vcpuset when CPUPinningUnknown raised

When exception.CPUPinningUnknown or exception.CPUUnPinningUnknown
is raised, the value of known vcpuset is NUMACell's pinned_cpus,
it should be NUMACell's cpuset.

Close-Bug: #1729784
Change-Id: I1902dc40623af62fd83fac222099f664d7d19ed9
(cherry picked from commit ecf12a4dd132e4aa9c2e3563a41acc0ab6d13978)

commit_message:
Only use ethtool if present

Else this would issue an error in gates, during the log step.

Change-Id: I55b310e6def8873ed5739f5f5176b867bc89443d

subject: Hopefully fixes bug 1671636
messages:
[{'account_id': 26803, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-20 15:59:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-11-21 07:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi, thank you for your contribution.
But OpenStack community have some conventions and related tools that you may want to know:

- add Closes-Bug: <number> in commit message if your change fixed the bug [1]
- You can run `tox -e pep8` in your local repository to check PEP8 before push them to gerrit (and run `tox` command to run all of test)


[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#working-on-bugs'}, {'account_id': 26803, 'date': '2017-11-23 15:40:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi thank you for the reply. 
 * I changed the commit message to Closes-Bug: 1671636
 * `tox -e pep8` was successful but tox resulted in below error (Not sure how to handle this)

ERROR:   py35: could not install deps [-r/home/pavan/projects/designate/requirements.txt, -r/home/pavan/projects/designate/test-requirements.txt]; v = InvocationError('/home/pavan/projects/designate/.tox/py35/bin/pip install -chttps://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=master -r/home/pavan/projects/designate/requirements.txt -r/home/pavan/projects/designate/test-requirements.txt (see /home/pavan/projects/designate/.tox/py35/log/py35-1.log)', 1)
  py27: commands succeeded
ERROR:   flake8: could not install deps [-r/home/pavan/projects/designate/test-requirements.txt]; v = InvocationError('/home/pavan/projects/designate/.tox/flake8/bin/pip install -chttps://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=master -r/home/pavan/projects/designate/test-requirements.txt (see /home/pavan/projects/designate/.tox/flake8/log/flake8-1.log)', 1)"}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2017-11-27 14:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The commit message should be something like this:

    Do not log error when zone is not expected to be found

    Only log an error if we are not sending a notify to the DNS
    server.

    Closes-Bug: #1671636


The failure is due to you using tabs instead of spaces: see

http://logs.openstack.org/67/521567/1/check/openstack-tox-pep8/463dfc7/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-11-20_16_05_17_570580'}, {'account_id': 26803, 'date': '2017-12-03 11:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this as new PS is submitted.'}]

commit_message:
use log api plugin const from neutron-lib

The constant LOG_API was rehomed into neutron-lib with commit
I208c976c3e7e43e27e1907ed196af8efccd73f22
This patch consumes it by removing the constant from neutron and
using lib's version of it instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I97b135730af9efaa3b32c99b415f89c8a254a782

commit_message:
Create a volume snapshot based on volume with non-ascii description

This test was uploaded since there was a bug [1] while creating a volume
snapshot if the description of the parent volume contains non-ascii code.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1383899

Change-Id: Ic0d89fd5ff47c334237d0a1345488fecf436dcb2

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I16998cab37287c26ea68f406e5f6832961f41fac

commit_message:
Refactor template_content_validator

Split the code in template_content_validator to two files:
- definitions_validator
- scenario_validator
The purpose is to make it easier to support per-version validation later on

Change-Id: Ib7716bbc592f22ab8d0b892736cae0c78affabe9

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ie218549ea695899e206278dde0911d56b274df75

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "objects: get, update and delete converted to Subnet OVO usage""

This reverts commit 1470baf02beb6e9f732129edc4c8979881ddea8f.

As Neutron uses own objects registry this commit should be safe
to merge again and it shoudn't break projects like midonet.

Change-Id: I51833eebb4b24207f395e1d4095b1809f191a480

updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 16.0.5

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Ie81038a02216e00f036612a4fa873b1fc46191b4
Change-Id: I1d381d2b8b809553dfcaf7266f3032154fecb1ca

I've nearly finished troubleshooting the failure at [1]. I found a place where barbican is mishandling the keystone v3 token associated with the user's volume create request. It is trying to create its own keystone session, but ends up using the keystone v2 plugin, and that endpoint is no longer valid.

I expect to have more information later today."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-22 11:14:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

> I've nearly finished troubleshooting the failure at [1]. I found a
 > place where barbican is mishandling the keystone v3 token
 > associated with the user's volume create request. It is trying to
 > create its own keystone session, but ends up using the keystone v2
 > plugin, and that endpoint is no longer valid.
 > 
 > I expect to have more information later today.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/28/499928/19/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-container/2c6efb2/logs/subnode-2/var/log/containers/cinder/cinder-api.log.txt.gz#_2017-11-20_21_22_08_372"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-22 11:20:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

Alan, good find! I think that's the issue: https://github.com/openstack/castellan/blob/master/castellan/key_manager/barbican_key_manager.py#L172

castellan doesn't pass the domain when it builds the keystone auth plugin from a context."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-22 11:51:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

> Alan, good find! I think that's the issue: https://github.com/openstack/castellan/blob/master/castellan/key_manager/barbican_key_manager.py#L172
 > 
 > castellan doesn't pass the domain when it builds the keystone auth
 > plugin from a context.

Yes! And this is exactly where I was heading. I discovered this at the very end of my day, yesterday, when I tripped across [2].

I assume the barbican fix is easy, which either of us can pursue. But I've got meetings this morning, and won't be able to get to it for a few more hours.

[2] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/identity/generic/base.py#L162"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-22 11:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Alan, if you can do the fix that would be great. That way I can +2 it and we can get it merged faster :D'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-22 16:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

I filed [1] and submitted a patch [2], but now I'm encountering additional problems when testing this in a local TripleO quickstart setup. Requests to create an encryption key still fail, and I'm seeing this in the barbican log:

"SecretStorePluginsNotConfigured: No secret store plugins have been configured"

It seems additional config settings may be needed beyond what TripleO is currently providing. We might need to hold off enabling the encrypted volume test until after the Barbican wrinkles are sorted out.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/barbican/+bug/1733898
[2] https://review.openstack.org/522286'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-23 05:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2017-11-23 14:07:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

commit_message:
Add compute-feature-enabled.attach_encrypted_volume to True

* It will execute tempest.scenario.test_encrypted_cinder_volumes.
  TestEncryptedCinderVolumes test in scenario002 and scenario017.

* Added auth.tempest_roles to which is needed for barbican

Depends-On: I3d4aea0959f31f0978c9774892b7c88d2eed6ce4
Change-Id: Ic0c7e5087bc657653918d4adee6e9997e1b48649

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I4f73c304de9474946c604726aba6e84cb7863431

commit_message:
Remove unused exceptions

Some of the exceptions defined in exception.py module are not used
anywhere. Some of them were added at the initial import from neutron
in the commit: 8aff29509f1f6cfc73973b8da3e55ed559ae1112

This patch removes all such unused exceptions.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I630960a5023e6ed776939d7c7d36a3d7d4b489e8

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I48cf1b21f4a3f6deea02c393ec435e412b472ccd

commit_message:
Modify incorrect debug meaasge in _inject_data

It attempts to show inject_info but can not format by %(info)
correctly,so we can use string directly.

Change-Id: Ib9c67757e0b1d833cf722eb8dfcc47a4414b6fb6
Closes-Bug: #1729294
(cherry picked from commit 76a4e42e8bb98c8d5f30d8fef7b0fafd3976b626)
