revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-10 13:30:40.000000000', 'message': 'upport costum datatype in capability

Currently if there is costum datatype definition in capability, the
parser will be error, the patch support custom datatype definition
in property for capability.

A example is as following:

topology_template:

  node_templates:

    TestNode:
      type: tosca.nodes.SomeNode
      capabilities:
        cap1:
          properties:
            data:
              name: test
              value: 1

node_types:
  tosca.nodes.SomeNode:
    derived_from: tosca.nodes.Root
    capabilities:
      cap1:
        type: tosca.capabilities.SomeCap

capability_types:
  tosca.capabilities.SomeCap:
    derived_from: tosca.capabilities.Root
    properties:
      data:
        type: tosca.datatypes.SomeData

data_types:
  tosca.datatypes.SomeData:
    derived_from: tosca.datatypes.Root
    properties:
      name:
        type: string
        required: true
      value:
        type: integer
        required: false
        default: 100

Change-Id: Ic899fd125840f817b06b05aacf0829aa2d82ffa0
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>
'}, {'created': '2017-08-28 09:00:28.000000000', 'message': 'Adding custom datatypes support in properties of capabilities

Currently if there is costum datatype definition in capability, the
parser will be error, the patch support custom datatype definition
in property for capability.

Change-Id: Ic899fd125840f817b06b05aacf0829aa2d82ffa0
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>
'}]
commit_message:
Adding custom datatypes support in properties of capabilities

Currently if there is costum datatype definition in capability, the
parser will be error, the patch support custom datatype definition
in property for capability.

Change-Id: Ic899fd125840f817b06b05aacf0829aa2d82ffa0
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>

Add ironic api/pxe health checks during kolla build

Adds missing HEALHCHECK CMD directive to ironic pxe and api container images.

messages:

commit_message:
Correctly implements substacks support

It now correctly implements the multiple files API.
It also adds support for dependencies of a scalable server,
like SoftwareDeployment for example.

Change-Id: I7ba5e461695acec8fa2b2ddea5b1b5fc69268477

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 18:19:34.000000000', 'message': "Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ib240b8c16dce80910d952e9eec860669af1ec399
"}]
commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ib240b8c16dce80910d952e9eec860669af1ec399

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-25 21:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

subject: Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-01 18:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-02 15:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 17:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 17:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:\n\nremoved -U - will remove from master as well...'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-02 21:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 18:38:13.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

tools/tox_install.sh.

commit_message:
Added parameters to assign already present options in neutron.conf and lbaas_agent.ini

  Giving an opportunity for the users to assign
  already present options such as
  ovs_integration_bridge option in neutron.conf
  and ovs_use_veth in lbaas_agent.ini configuration files on overcloud.

Change-Id: I023e0476e574d5a4c13d66da390aa13016566058
(cherry picked from commit d06ba1f7a02336664999ec66719bb42a0d261f1a)

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I39d00ea09cc1f83ecf9caaa41365e9f550000c2a

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ifaaf656effff20ef08214f111645a3b5fc8b4d28

Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I9f2ad4af40ae0ce46a2e01d25e335820079ec66c

commit_message:
Fix swift port conflict

To avoid any port conflict, whether on LB or on bare metal nodes,
we should make sure each service runs on its own port.

The 8080 port is already used by swift, and opendaylight.
We keep 8080 for swift, move opendaylight to 8180, and the
pypiserver to 8280 to avoid overlaps when everything runs on metal.

Closes-Bug: 1735764
Change-Id: I69dd043efe5d2e50e83014bdbd6a848bfcc2aa39

subject: Do not use lsns to kill non-containerized epmd on the host
messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2017-12-01 22:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-02 15:32:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 22:43:51.000000000', 'message': "Do not use lsns to kill non-containerized epmd on the host

In a containerized HA environment, the Erlang port mapper daemon is
started via pacemaker. If an epmd runs on the host, it must be killed
to prevent it from holding the epmd port.

The current way of searching for non-containerized epmd is broken in
case lsns returns an error. Use pgrep's namespace filtering instead.

Change-Id: I29d451716c8e955b9e114a289ac1e22d2af35f1a
Closes-Bug: #1735698
(cherry picked from commit 63bea76e56d6289b3431310a83e89a315f11d680)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use lsns to kill non-containerized epmd on the host

In a containerized HA environment, the Erlang port mapper daemon is
started via pacemaker. If an epmd runs on the host, it must be killed
to prevent it from holding the epmd port.

The current way of searching for non-containerized epmd is broken in
case lsns returns an error. Use pgrep's namespace filtering instead.

Change-Id: I29d451716c8e955b9e114a289ac1e22d2af35f1a
Closes-Bug: #1735698
(cherry picked from commit 63bea76e56d6289b3431310a83e89a315f11d680)

commit_message:
Do not force using the remote "origin" when testing upgrades

Zuul checkout of origin/stable/pike doesn't work, and needs
only stable/pike instead [1].

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/openstack-ansible-upgrade-ceph-ubuntu-xenial/f835b74/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-11-24_06_08_06_547867

Change-Id: Ib2bee665e164f02817487c311e125329d54c43d8
(cherry picked from commit ebfd9ab9ae9153f78ccf8084179963922403c3fa)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I20a622f42e120659306ac9558429a0435cda1857

[{'created': '2017-03-27 19:13:06.000000000', 'message': 'Use encode_headers() after setting common headers in SessionClient

encode_headers convert headers parameters to byte string.
In _set_common_request_kwargs() method, we try to get content-type
from header as a string value. This method does not set for
byte string.

Hence, for python 3.x, _set_common_request_kwargs() adds content-type
to header even if custom content-type is set in the request.

This results in unsupported media type exception when glance client
is used with keystoneauth and python 3.x

This change addresses this problem by calling encode headers after
setting common header params in SessionClient.

Change-Id: I183d412516d0c427d6f958ffe90a43a8e5e5a1a7
Closes-Bug: #1676550
'}, {'created': '2017-03-28 15:18:21.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Use encode_headers() after setting common headers in SessionClient

commit_message:
[WIP] Use encode_headers() after setting common headers in SessionClient

encode_headers convert headers parameters to byte string.
In _set_common_request_kwargs() method, we try to get content-type
from header as a string value. This method does not set for
byte string.

Hence, for python 3.x, _set_common_request_kwargs() adds content-type
to header even if custom content-type is set in the request.

This results in unsupported media type exception when glance client
is used with keystoneauth and python 3.x

This change addresses this problem by calling encode headers after
setting common header params in SessionClient.

Change-Id: I183d412516d0c427d6f958ffe90a43a8e5e5a1a7
Closes-Bug: #1676550

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I4d8af466a96832000070196b81772b1325d0765c

commit_message:
fset030: configure and run tempest for OVN scenario007 container job

The commit with change id - Id08ee56fed940213b7fb65358d8d57adf0a84f9b
which enabled tempest for fset28 - OVN scenario007 job has wrongly set
the tempest check for fset32 instead of fset28. This patch corrects
that in doc/source/feature-configuration.rst.

Change-Id: I2b54bfe1ed45ceaf18f8b58c9b0f423b4c5795d5

commit_message:
v2: send the image size when uploading it.

Currently, when using v2 and sending an image chunk by chunk, we do not
send the total size of the image. This cannot be done using the
Content-Length header, since this would imply that we send the image
"all at once", so let's just use the same header as in v1.

Change-Id: I4c3c2da650067d285d1fe4dade73f8c33884354b
Closes-Bug: #1627147
Depends-On: Iee2e91ff8fc7077cf2f2f61f1295c90c842d3fa9

messages:
[{'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2016-09-28 18:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-09-28 22:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-glance-python34-db http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-glance-python34-db/e369c46/ : SUCCESS in 4m 02s

- gate-glance-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-glance-docs-ubuntu-xenial/b4063a5//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 8m 52s
- gate-glance-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-glance-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/de2fb0f/ : SUCCESS in 3m 23s
- gate-glance-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-glance-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial/35cf051/ : SUCCESS in 9m 47s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial/92cc6b0/ : SUCCESS in 1h 08m 40s
- gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial/588f403/ : SUCCESS in 32m 37s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial/333732b/ : SUCCESS in 41m 40s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/c178edc/ : SUCCESS in 49m 39s (non-voting)
- gate-rally-dsvm-glance http://logs.openstack.org/53/378953/1/check/gate-rally-dsvm-glance/bdfae63/ : SUCCESS in 27m 01s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2016-09-29 09:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This seems to be a fundamental V2 API change masquerading as a bug fix?'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2016-09-29 15:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Stuart: this is actually a bug fix, please read my (long) comment on the bug report. We need to know the full size of the image to fix this bug, but cannot seem to pass it using the "Content-Length" header.

I'm obviously open to suggestions on how to do this in a cleaner way :)'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2016-09-29 16:59:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Cyril,

Sure. I guess I just meant to say that we really need to think if we can avoid having to change the v2 API to add a v1-style header to fix the issue.

As far as I remember, one of the main reasons for introducing the v2 API was to switch from using headers for metadata to using json in the body for meta data. So this feels a bit as if it goes against that design principle.

I'm a bit short on cycles to come up with alternatives right now (sorry!)."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2016-09-29 17:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe we could set the size in json when we first create the image (POST)?'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2016-09-30 09:25:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thinking about this a bit more...

From the client point of view there are two cases:

1. The client knows the image size before hand (eg the image is /tmp/image.qcow2)

2. The client doesn't know the image size before hand (eg the image is being created by a process and piped into the client)


It should be possible to do something as follows (Didn't we do this in the v1 client?)


For case (1):

The client can set the Content-Length header, and does not need to use the Transfer-Encoding header.

For case (2):

The client doesn't know the size, so can use the Transfer-Encoding header and not set the Content-Length header.

If we made that change we should add *comprehensive* client and server side tests.


We would need to add tests to check the equivalent of:


1) Piped input (style 1)

dd if=/dev/random bs=1048576 count=1 | glance ...

2) Piped input (style 2)

cat /etc/fstab | glance ...

3) fifo

[terminal 1] mkfifo /tmp/fifo
[terminal 2] glance ... < /tmp/fifo
[terminal 1] echo hi > /tmp/fifo

4) file

glance ... --file /tmp/image.qcow2"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2016-09-30 10:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

5) --file where the file is a fifo ?'}, {'account_id': 12000, 'date': '2017-01-24 17:05:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I have to agree with Stuart. Using a v1 style header when those are explicitly forbidden for new APIs by the API-WG is a bad idea, especially when part of the reason for v2 was to move away from those very headers.

Second, I think that Stuart's on the right path with sending this with the initial POST. I understand that doesn't always work, but that's the best bet IMO"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-29 15:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-02 19:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning due to lack of activity.  Bug has been updated.'}]

commit_message:
v2: Read the X-Image-Meta-Size header when deserializing a request.

When sending the image data chunk by chunk, one may not set the
Content-Length, but we still need to know the full size of the image.
Let's use the same header as in v1 for this purpose.

Change-Id: Iee2e91ff8fc7077cf2f2f61f1295c90c842d3fa9
Partial-Bug: #1627147

commit_message:
changed the testcases according to the fix.

The unit test cases are failing due to my fix, as the test case
expecting tags in update command.

But my fix makes the update command to get only the given "property"
and updates the same but not tags as expected in testcase.

Change-Id: I2e20a6611ff31971139aba305122b614a4922d73
Closes-Bug: #1555662

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I11127d4cc7263ced57309952b71df1c7813f57d6

commit_message:
Checks if updated properties are actually updated or not in v2

When an image is updated , v2 doesn't check if any parameter
is actually being updated. This patch generates a message if
none of the parameters is getting updatated.

Closes-Bug: 1307412

Change-Id: I960f0af664f2af0bede47b7aaece1db66b536915

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-29 22:03:35.000000000', 'message': 'Support add multiple images/tenants in members

Previously, the member-create and member-delete commands allow only one
image and one tenant to be specified. With this patch, multiple images
and tenants can be added with one command.

Before, user could only run:
    1) glance member-create <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID>
    2) glance member-delete <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID>

Now, user also can also run:
    1) glance member-create --images <IMAGE> [<IMAGE> ...]
                            --tenants <TENANT_ID> [<TENANT_ID> ...]
    2) glance member-delete --images <IMAGE> [<IMAGE> ...]
                              --tenants <TENANT_ID> [<TENANT_ID> ...]

A user has option to specify multiple images and tenants with one
command. This helps to make the client more user-friendly.

Change-Id: Ia60775f5aeb3bb860f6525a6eef139701ae59f1c
Closes-Bug: #1221757

commit_message:
Support add multiple tenants in members

Previously, the member-create and member-delete commands allow only one
tenant to be specified. With this patch, multiple tenants can be added
with one command.

Before, user could only run:
    1) glance member-create <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID>
    2) glance member-delete <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID>

Now, user also can also run:
    1) glance member-create <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID> [<TENANT_ID> ...]
    2) glance member-delete <IMAGE> <TENANT_ID> [<TENANT_ID> ...]

A user has option to specify additional tenants with one
command. This helps to make the client more user-friendly.

Change-Id: Ia60775f5aeb3bb860f6525a6eef139701ae59f1c
Closes-Bug: #1221757

There are two steps in the function of 'do_image_show' in
glanceclient/glance/v1/shell.py,the first step is 'find_resource',
the second step is 'gc.images.get()',the return value of
'find_resource' is the same with 'gc.images.get()'.
so remove step two to speed up command 'glance image-show'.

Closes-Bug #1548200

Change-Id: Ic8bdf9143b7bb9d9742e7620321b86780efdf2bc
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize function 'do_image_show' in v1 client

There are two steps in the function of 'do_image_show' in
glanceclient/glance/v1/shell.py,the first step is 'find_resource',
the second step is 'gc.images.get()',the return value of
'find_resource' is the same with 'gc.images.get()'.
so remove step two to speed up command 'glance image-show'.

Closes-Bug #1548200

Change-Id: Ic8bdf9143b7bb9d9742e7620321b86780efdf2bc

commit_message:
glance member-list help not appropriate

The help for glance member-list shows
both image-id and tenant-id as optional
parameters but the command doesnt works
without image or tenant ID specified.

So, updated the help so as guide the user
that he has to use either of the optional
parameters for the command to work.

Change-Id: Ia6f1a489c932e19d9f1a11d9adad411400d78c77
Closes-Bug: #1551567

commit_message:
glance member-list help not appropriate

The help for glance member-list shows
both image-id and tenant-id as optional
parameters but the command doesnt works
without image or tenant ID specified.

So, updated the help so as guide the user
that he has to use either of the optional
parameters for the command to work.

Change-Id: I3ffbb5a0edaa7a4e369602cb776a753c1076f804
Closes-Bug: #1564326

Absolutely not. We are not going to break the user land for such artificial requirement.'}, {'account_id': 14780, 'date': '2016-04-13 06:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Absolutely not. We are not going to break the user land for such
 > artificial requirement.

 > Absolutely not. We are not going to break the user land for such
 > artificial requirement.

@

 > Absolutely not. We are not going to break the user land for such
 > artificial requirement.

@erno kuvaja This bug is for addition of the argument in the glance image-create command, which as per the discussion on the bug page seems to be logical to implement. I dont know why you dont want this.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2016-04-13 11:20:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm a big fan of preserving backwards compatibility. IMHO we should try to avoid changes which could break users' stuff wherever possible.

An aside: surprisingly, the client behaves differently when data is supplied on stdin:

 $ echo data | glance image-create 
 error: Must provide --container-format, --disk-format when using stdin.

(I'm guessing that's more by accident than design.)"}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2016-04-20 15:20:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Stuart,

That's actually not accidental. This is the fail early check we made for it as those two are needed parameters for the image to transition to active (which happens when the upload completes).

The image-upload will (or should at least) give you the same error as you see there if you try to upload the image data before setting those properties.

What Shashwat is proposing is introducing artificial blocker to create empty image placeholder. And backwards incompatible as mentioned."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-12-02 19:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No activity for >1 year, plus the bug this fixes is classified as a "Won't Fix".  Reading through that discussion, it sounds like something like this change could be proposed as a spec-lite to the python glanceclient if it's proposed in such a way to get around the backward-incompatibility issues Stuart and Erno point out.'}]

'}]
commit_message:
Glance image-create should have atleast one argument

Creating a glance image without any argument should not be done.
So adding at least one parameter to be given while creating a image.

Closes-Bug: #1184965

Change-Id: I993b780f58f7d0aee33095554e85f7371701abd4

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: If030c81dfb5b1e016cf5335815a7e6e65b921a7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 18:31:22.000000000', 'message': "Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ie46c216d73da31d5fdd2ff1301e2d21af6eab0df
"}]
commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ie46c216d73da31d5fdd2ff1301e2d21af6eab0df

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I04613ffda0f9a15bcc5a7fe67fafc22fd08cd204

commit_message:
Update glance-specs to use openstackdocstheme

Maintenance on oslosphinx ended with the Pike release.  This
patch includes the following changes:
* switch to openstackdocstheme
* set context options for openstackdocstheme
  - glance-specs doesn't have its own bug tracker, so config
    to create bugs in the glance bug tracker with tag 'glance-specs'
* update requirements file
* update setup.cfg to use warning-is-error
* update four specs whose warnings were previously ignored
* add an '_extra' directory with stub .htaccess file
* configure docs build to include '_extra'
* update build command in tox.ini

Change-Id: I4da477fd39685a22fb4ef9d702af9b9a79bda0c2

commit_message:
fix telemetry install guide links

zuulv3 uses openstack/service-types-authority to target where
docs should be generated. this location has and will changed.

for more details, see: Ib03cc560868db725e151e0e8c9107846137f5d27

Depends-On: Ib03cc560868db725e151e0e8c9107846137f5d27

commit_message:
scenario002: configure SimpleCryptoKek

Some work in progress is made to enable a default plugin with a
generated key for Barbican but until this is done, let's set the
parameters in the scenario002 environment, so we can start testing
boot from encrypted volume.

Change-Id: I3d4aea0959f31f0978c9774892b7c88d2eed6ce4

'}, {'created': '2017-11-28 19:07:07.000000000', 'message': "add whereto for testing redirects

Set up whereto so that any redirect rules added to the .htaccess file
can be tested.

Move the .htaccess file into the directory expected by the
build-openstack-sphinx-docs, which has a hard-coded path for '_extra'
based on how other projects were set up at the time the job was
written. That whereto command is triggered automatically when whereto
is present in the dependency list for the project, and the change to
tox.ini in this patch is a convenience for developers running the
build locally.

Change-Id: I2238a2163c26b7df9c6a3dfaf0f8701631ff2cc5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add whereto for testing redirects

Set up whereto so that any redirect rules added to the .htaccess file
can be tested.

Change-Id: I2238a2163c26b7df9c6a3dfaf0f8701631ff2cc5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove duplicated content from "Admin Guide"

There was content in the developer docs targeted to operators which is better
kept in the Admin Guide under docs.openstack.org

This change moves the appropriate items, adds a link to that location (pending
the dependant patch for that link to work), and retains the content which was
inappropriate to move to that location.

Change-Id: I7f47dfa5dca9cad99aca07e8913fa2f11b349b97
Depends-On: I3431f4c4393c827d0d6fdab6b55a6b013f8e6930

[{'created': '2017-12-01 21:41:20.000000000', 'message': 'Trivial: Nix duplicate PlacementFixture() in test

[1] fixed a test to make sure the placement fixture was set up before
the compute service started (since compute startup uses placement now)
but left behind the old call that had set it up afterwards.  This change
just removes the duplicate.

[1] I12de2e195022593ea2a3e2894f2c3b5226930d4f

Change-Id: I3f651728891cd5782e50c7ec4634ebb57151d5c2
'}]
commit_message:
Trivial: Nix duplicate PlacementFixture() in test

[1] fixed a test to make sure the placement fixture was set up before
the compute service started (since compute startup uses placement now)
but left behind the old call that had set it up afterwards.  This change
just removes the duplicate.

[1] I12de2e195022593ea2a3e2894f2c3b5226930d4f

Change-Id: I3f651728891cd5782e50c7ec4634ebb57151d5c2

commit_message:
Use oslo_cache in auth_token middleware

Use the new oslo.cache library instead of using memcached directly.
This keeps the old options around and will continue to use those in
preference to the oslo.config library as there is no way to test whether
oslo.cache was explicitly configured to use that in preference.

Currently there are no messages or anything to deprecate the old options
until we've had a chance to test it in production environments.

Closes-Bug: #1523375
Change-Id: Ifccacc5db311ad538ce60191cbe221644d1a5807
Co-Authored-By: Nicolas Helgeson <nh202b@att.com>

uhm, we just need to upload a file to db. So I think you can use a dynamic endpoint like "job-bianries/{file-name}"or you can use a static endpoint name like "job-bianries/uploading". All up to you.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-03-27 06:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I may remember incorrectly, but wasn't the idea to get rid of internal job binaries and use the other storing solutions?"}, {'account_id': 22689, 'date': '2017-03-27 07:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> use the other storing solutions?

Hi, Luigi. do you know where we can find history about this issue? As you know, Marianne and I are new contributor to you. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-03-27 08:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't find right now the "final" decision, I need to dig deeper and we can probably discuss it again during the next meeting. It was around for a while and discussed in Austin, see the logs of these meeting just before that Summit:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/sahara/2016/sahara.2016-03-17-18.00.log.html

and also the related etherpad: 
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/sahara-newton-summit

It was originally mentioned in a comment in the v2 spec (around line 134: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212172/3/specs/backlog/api-v2-experimental-impl.rst).'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-03-27 08:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, see the last comments in bugs like:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/sahara/+bug/1427304
https://bugs.launchpad.net/sahara/+bug/1427328'}, {'account_id': 16625, 'date': '2017-03-27 18:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Luigi,

> I may remember incorrectly, but wasn't the idea to get rid of internal job binaries and use the other storing solutions?

Yes, I think so! egafford told me about this, but I don't know what is the current status of this, and if it will be done after or before the APIv2 is stable. I think we can talk about it in Sahara's meeting this week, and then we see what would be the best approach for this patch."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2017-03-28 11:39:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Agree about raising the question during the meeting.
I personally think that if it should be done, the change to APIv2 is the right time to implement it (it's already a disruptive change in itself)."}, {'account_id': 16625, 'date': '2017-04-11 17:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-11 18:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

job binary type, so it will use the already existing job binary
endpoints.

Change-Id: Iee70e9f6b4471b50105974c7c77169303c4159de
Partial-Implements: bp v2-api-experimental-impl

By not including support for job binary internal in APIv2 at all, there
will be a clearer path towards the eventual removal of the JBI feature.

Since JBI will be an APIv1 exclusive, that means we can safely remove
support JBI upon APIv1's removal without affecting APIv2 users.

Change-Id: Iee70e9f6b4471b50105974c7c77169303c4159de
Partial-Implements: bp v2-api-experimental-impl
Partial-Implements: bp remove-job-binary-internal

commit_message:
[APIv2] Remove job-binary-internal endpoint

By not including support for job binary internal in APIv2 at all, there
will be a clearer path towards the eventual removal of the JBI feature.

Since JBI will be an APIv1 exclusive, that means we can safely remove
support JBI upon APIv1's removal without affecting APIv2 users.

Change-Id: Iee70e9f6b4471b50105974c7c77169303c4159de
Partial-Implements: bp v2-api-experimental-impl
Partial-Implements: bp remove-job-binary-internal

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 08:38:26.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ibb97ddc7dc3a1c1cd7b4734377188fa625ddef7e
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ibb97ddc7dc3a1c1cd7b4734377188fa625ddef7e

commit_message:
Add osc-tox-unit-tips jobs

It's super important that changes to openstacksdk don't break
python-openstackclient. Run openstacksdk's unit test tips jobs to make
sure we don't.

Change-Id: I8059ff058835e658c8192c46f6512de1f9ea3152
Depends-On: I599b18218c10cb08e508cca3b3bbc9c88b8f809c

commit_message:
Remove keystoneclient and ironicclient as direct depends

shade will still use them if they are there, and will report the error
to the user that they should install them by hand if they need the
methods that still need the libs. This will let our release have a MUCH
smaller set of depends, and should not cause havor. bifrost already
installs python-ironicclient itself.

Put the libs in test-requirements so that unittest mocks continue to
work.

Change-Id: I5a34397414d531a520a6694ae239e8e91f4b9d47

subject: Optimize model relationships (avoid joins, prefer subquery)
messages: [{'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-12-01 05:22:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/pike.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-12-01 12:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-12-01 12:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2017-12-01 20:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20663, 'date': '2017-12-02 05:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2017-12-02 13:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 05:22:51.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize model relationships (avoid joins, prefer subquery)

There are a large number of unnecessary joins which are currently
duplicating data and increasing the number of rows for simple
SQL queries.

It is not very easy to add the lazyloading again without a big
change in the architecture due to the dependence of these
components.  For those relationships that require to be there,
they will use `subquery` which will send much less data over
the line.  For the relationships that can be lazyloaded,
it was dropped.

Change-Id: Iddaaf7168611763a6fa76818e3be9d1aa24d8021
(cherry picked from commit e20d0bee721d93d8a2de7c22582e27af95c93386)
(cherry picked from commit 5db8553a46fe23a5f75ed46654b3a4ee6203f869)
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize model relationships (avoid joins, prefer subquery)

There are a large number of unnecessary joins which are currently
duplicating data and increasing the number of rows for simple
SQL queries.

It is not very easy to add the lazyloading again without a big
change in the architecture due to the dependence of these
components.  For those relationships that require to be there,
they will use `subquery` which will send much less data over
the line.  For the relationships that can be lazyloaded,
it was dropped.

Change-Id: Iddaaf7168611763a6fa76818e3be9d1aa24d8021
(cherry picked from commit e20d0bee721d93d8a2de7c22582e27af95c93386)
(cherry picked from commit 5db8553a46fe23a5f75ed46654b3a4ee6203f869)

commit_message:
tox: Don't create *.pyc files during unit/functional tests

Don't create *.pyc files during unit/functional tests as they just add
cruft during tox runs.

This is similar to what we already do in openstack/ironic

Change-Id: Id4364519903db20308f78f2aaeca3ad2d37b298a

task.

commit_message:
Do not implement reload for novnc/spice service

The nova-novncproxy and nova-spicehtml5proxy services do not
support using a HUP signal to reload, so the init file for
them should not implement a reload.

Depends-On: Id4b9caa1cdfd0f53023548c4ede5d497d64c873d
Change-Id: I36e2200e2ca43d87208d2c4edb17b98654bb121e
(cherry picked from commit 0a976790b975def34b4aad1964e2c769fff97b41)

The nova-novncproxy and nova-spicehtml5proxy services do not
support using a HUP signal to reload, so the init file for
them should not implement a reload.

Depends-On: Id4b9caa1cdfd0f53023548c4ede5d497d64c873d
Change-Id: I36e2200e2ca43d87208d2c4edb17b98654bb121e
(cherry picked from commit 0a976790b975def34b4aad1964e2c769fff97b41)

commit_message:
Gather more logs when running tests

This change updates our log collection script so that it is once again
grabbing logs from services and containers but this time far more
conservatively.

Depends-On: I3c1b755e4bed6a209c127258b79d3ef557caf19e
Change-Id: Ifae67fa3bb3dd790f806bc73de5068f0998cb4e6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Collect package and repository info on Ubuntu

The script supports collecting information for packages and
repositories for openSUSE and CentOS but not for Ubuntu so add the
appropriate commands for it. This also fixes some indentation issues.

Change-Id: I9a2eca110cdf6d1186c867b5bb632ba48580f070
(cherry picked from commit 43abd60d1617e94fba80d7f35e89451a66a10b9b)

commit_message:
test-set-nodepool-vars: Fix mirror variable on CentOS7

The mirros are now configured in the openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts
role and the correct variable to set on CentOS is
openstack_hosts_centos_mirror_url.

Change-Id: Iaf3289af1e02a1cafb93577d634477f27a8008be

subject: Add ExecStartPre command to lxc-dnsmasq service unit
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-02 05:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-02 10:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-02 11:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 05:22:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add ExecStartPre command to lxc-dnsmasq service unit

When upgrading from an older deployment without the lxc-dnsmaq service
unit it's possible for the lxc-dnsmasq process to have been left in
a defunct state; this is especially true when upgrading as the
background process will have been started as a post-up command within the
lxcbr0 interface configuration. If the service is in a defunct state, or
running without a valid pid file, the systemd service unit will fail to
start.

This change ensures systemd will clean up all processes owned by the
lxc-dnsmaq user with a limited scope of processes matching a regex of
"^dnsmasq" which is only effectuve when the service is not managed by
systemd and in a defunct state.

Change-Id: If183f0b6dfbe0646384cf3bb3b89bc3901643c1e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 69ab10bee5386dbef6ca328743e669400cd9b65e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ExecStartPre command to lxc-dnsmasq service unit

When upgrading from an older deployment without the lxc-dnsmaq service
unit it's possible for the lxc-dnsmasq process to have been left in
a defunct state; this is especially true when upgrading as the
background process will have been started as a post-up command within the
lxcbr0 interface configuration. If the service is in a defunct state, or
running without a valid pid file, the systemd service unit will fail to
start.

This change ensures systemd will clean up all processes owned by the
lxc-dnsmaq user with a limited scope of processes matching a regex of
"^dnsmasq" which is only effectuve when the service is not managed by
systemd and in a defunct state.

Change-Id: If183f0b6dfbe0646384cf3bb3b89bc3901643c1e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 69ab10bee5386dbef6ca328743e669400cd9b65e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 08:45:43.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I1d1d00202782b421d0c0fa4c4becf1fcf35612d6
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I1d1d00202782b421d0c0fa4c4becf1fcf35612d6

subject: Fix update APT cache condition
messages: [{'account_id': 11290, 'date': '2017-12-01 14:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-12-01 21:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-02 10:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 14:45:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix update APT cache condition

With the block/rescue error handling introduced in
62ecbd9eb60fe8e3b676a267c2ae84b623fc8bd4 the add_keys_fallback variable
is no longer defined unless there was an error contacting the primary
keyserver. This change checks if the variable is defined first.

This bug only applies to Newton. Later releases have the update APT
cache task removed as it's no longer needed with Ansible 2.2.

Change-Id: Ie19f4c674292009d95eb3504af03af77ddb42e7d
Closes-Bug: #1727778
"}]
commit_message:
Fix update APT cache condition

With the block/rescue error handling introduced in
62ecbd9eb60fe8e3b676a267c2ae84b623fc8bd4 the add_keys_fallback variable
is no longer defined unless there was an error contacting the primary
keyserver. This change checks if the variable is defined first.

This bug only applies to Newton. Later releases have the update APT
cache task removed as it's no longer needed with Ansible 2.2.

Change-Id: Ie19f4c674292009d95eb3504af03af77ddb42e7d
Closes-Bug: #1727778

commit_message:
Disable offloading in test by default

We disable offloading in test for ubuntu this change does the same for
suse and cent. This should help resolve network stability issues and
kernel traces we've been seeing in the gate.

Depends-On: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Change-Id: I6e8eaf7a668f140c1de4f541a414d13caf7d8b61
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Replace the usage of some aliases in tempest

In tempest, following aliases have been moved in version Pike
and will be removed in version Queens:ad
* manager > os_primary [1]
* admin_manager > os_admin [2]
* os_adm > os_admin [3]
* os > os_primary [4]
* alt_manager > os_alt [5]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468036/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/467852/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/467605/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/466991/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457555/

Change-Id: Ie3b93dd2cf457a5cb42a53eadc9f9fd5cec1f118

commit_message:
fs001: run tempest instead of pingtest

For consistency purpose in testing, let's run tempest instead of
pingtest. It also removes the heat requirement deployed on the
overcloud.

Depends-On: I7c2957d7cf97725f0b759752e5775fefeed69d70
Change-Id: Iae7d8418b7b0a3b7e1bbc8bc12cad6b81acfcc84

commit_message:
Revert "Fix TLS everywhere containerized deployments"

By removing the tls-everywhere environment, the netiso env was removed. It broke ovb-ha.

This reverts commit 5898f59fb334751dcb289d1247a5958b31318af7.

Change-Id: I22c7e32c0364f58938da450c56cc2476871cae6a

commit_message:
Enables websocket based port status for OpenDaylight

Port Status in ODL was previously disabled due to bugs which have now
been resolved.  This patch enables it via Neutron ML2 conf.  Port status
is communicated by ODL through a websocket connection on port 8185.
Therefore we need to enable haproxy to load balance across that port.

Related-Bug: 1718508

Change-Id: Iebdcc6404f5503eeb45b39380b3f198be175514b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Run enable_ssh_admin also for Nova+Ironic deployments

For Nova+Ironic deployments we could run the enable_ssh_admin Mistral
workflow directly and take advantage of the public key injection via
os-collect-config, but since the script seems to work for both
deployed-server and Nova/Ironic envs, we can just use it
unconditionally and keep the logic DRY.

Change-Id: I2bae54d282591abc8a014cdce805e90305a7a34d
Closes-Bug: #1735173

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 15:31:06.000000000', 'message': "scripts: scripts-library.sh: Use pgrep -f to find the dstat process

The dstat process is actually a python script so running 'pgrep dstat'
will not match it

~# pgrep dstat
~# ps aux|grep dstat
root      5322  1.0  0.2  42888  8876 pts/0    S    16:16   0:00 python /usr/bin/dstat -tcmsdn --top-cpu --top-mem --top-bio --nocolor --output dstat.csv 3

However, we can use 'pgrep -f' to search for 'dstat' in the entire
procees string.

~# pgrep -f dstat
5322

Change-Id: I17c181bf957626cc11a1fe6f954e54c8abbfbd93
(cherry picked from commit 078c89bec9d9e7fefec6bfb454c34f07482e02c4)
"}]
commit_message:
scripts: scripts-library.sh: Use pgrep -f to find the dstat process

The dstat process is actually a python script so running 'pgrep dstat'
will not match it

~# pgrep dstat
~# ps aux|grep dstat
root      5322  1.0  0.2  42888  8876 pts/0    S    16:16   0:00 python /usr/bin/dstat -tcmsdn --top-cpu --top-mem --top-bio --nocolor --output dstat.csv 3

However, we can use 'pgrep -f' to search for 'dstat' in the entire
procees string.

~# pgrep -f dstat
5322

Change-Id: I17c181bf957626cc11a1fe6f954e54c8abbfbd93
(cherry picked from commit 078c89bec9d9e7fefec6bfb454c34f07482e02c4)

commit_message:
Layer 3 IPs rate limit

The patch proposes a general solution for the L3 IP QoS,which adds
`qos_policy_id` to the L3 IPs. Then the QoS rules will be used to
set the linux tc rules in router namespace efficiently. For the L3
users, the new attribute would indicate the bandwidth they can use.

Change-Id: If7dba69857a6758ef278905cd10434b1de4447b5
Related-Bug: #1596611

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 13:32:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update unless statement for cephx key checking.

Some cephx keys (manila) have specail features enabled via quoted
words in their capabilities list. The initial key is created on the
file system with escaped quotes (\"auth del\" and \"auth caps\").
However the output of ceph auth get does not excape these quotes.
This results in the grep in unless satement always failing and
causing the key to be reimported multiple times.

Change-Id: I2cf6d3ded28d2d37c10fbe9ffb29822b744a561c
'}, {'created': '2017-11-22 16:52:40.000000000', 'message': 'Update unless statement for cephx key checking.

Some cephx keys (manila) have specail features enabled via quoted
words in their capabilities list. The initial key is created on the
file system with escaped quotes (\"auth del\" and \"auth caps\").
However the output of ceph auth get does not excape these quotes.
This results in the grep in unless satement always failing and
causing the key to be reimported multiple times.

A Ceph tracker issue has been opend to for this issue. (1)

1: http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/22227

Change-Id: I2cf6d3ded28d2d37c10fbe9ffb29822b744a561c
'}]
commit_message:
Update unless statement for cephx key checking.

Some cephx keys (manila) have specail features enabled via quoted
words in their capabilities list. The initial key is created on the
file system with escaped quotes (\"auth del\" and \"auth caps\").
However the output of ceph auth get does not excape these quotes.
This results in the grep in unless satement always failing and
causing the key to be reimported multiple times.

A Ceph tracker issue has been opend to for this issue. (1)

1: http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/22227

Change-Id: I2cf6d3ded28d2d37c10fbe9ffb29822b744a561c

commit_message:
Add support for OVN Metadata Agent

This patch adds support for configuring networking-ovn-metadata-agent.

Change-Id: I38f775479d178f5b252619635b67f876bc8c5ed5
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use ipmi/command_retry_timeout instead of retry_timeout

The latter is now deprecated and will be silently ignored in the
future.

Change-Id: I5e858e66a8bbc45c4e45df7e57338c59bce0430f
Closes-bug: #1734322

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-30 21:05:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for address family parameters

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 07:29:40.000000000', 'message': "Do not implement reload for novnc/spice service

The nova-novncproxy and nova-spicehtml5proxy services do
not support using a HUP signal to reload, so they need to
be restarted instead.

This patch ensures that these services are restarted, and
also fixes a bug that hasn't been noticed before where if
the Placement API and other nova services are implemented
on the same host/container then the other services would
not be restarted. It would play out like this:

- The first task asks to reload all nova services execute
  against all nova hosts, except those running the placement
  api. This results in only the compute hosts getting the
  reload.

- The second task only asks the nova placement API to
  restart. This leaves out all the other nova services
  which are on the same host.

Change-Id: Id4b9caa1cdfd0f53023548c4ede5d497d64c873d
Needed-By: I36e2200e2ca43d87208d2c4edb17b98654bb121e
(cherry picked from commit fe9a338b13411ca0f969dd9e71f6cfc309162c44)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not implement reload for novnc/spice service

The nova-novncproxy and nova-spicehtml5proxy services do
not support using a HUP signal to reload, so they need to
be restarted instead.

This patch ensures that these services are restarted, and
also fixes a bug that hasn't been noticed before where if
the Placement API and other nova services are implemented
on the same host/container then the other services would
not be restarted. It would play out like this:

- The first task asks to reload all nova services execute
  against all nova hosts, except those running the placement
  api. This results in only the compute hosts getting the
  reload.

- The second task only asks the nova placement API to
  restart. This leaves out all the other nova services
  which are on the same host.

Change-Id: Id4b9caa1cdfd0f53023548c4ede5d497d64c873d
Needed-By: I36e2200e2ca43d87208d2c4edb17b98654bb121e
(cherry picked from commit fe9a338b13411ca0f969dd9e71f6cfc309162c44)

[{'created': '2017-11-30 17:42:50.000000000', 'message': 'Proper error handling by _ensure_resource_provider

Previously, if _ensure_resource_provider encountered any error from the
placement REST API, it would (sometimes log a message and) return None.

Furthermore, a name conflict while creating the provider was treated the
same as a UUID conflict, which would actually result in None being
returned.

With this change set, the error paths that previously returned None now
raise one of the new ResourceProviderRetrievalFailed or
ResourceProviderCreationFailed exceptions; and the name conflict path is
detected and treated as an error condition.

Change-Id: I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36
Closes-Bug: #1735430
'}, {'created': '2017-11-30 18:16:37.000000000', 'message': 'Proper error handling by _ensure_resource_provider

placement REST API, it would (sometimes log a message and) return None.

Furthermore, a name conflict while creating the provider was treated the
same as a UUID conflict, which would actually result in None being

With this change set, the error paths that previously returned None now
raise one of the new ResourceProviderRetrievalFailed or
ResourceProviderCreationFailed exceptions; and the name conflict path is
detected and treated as an error condition.

Note: This change set only touches the SchedulerReportClient side of
these error conditions - it makes no attempt to add error handling to
its callers.  Case in point, the API samples tests needed fixing because

these error conditions - it makes no attempt to add error handling to
its callers.  Case in point, the API samples tests needed fixing because
they were previously running into the name conflict error condition, but
not noticing.  As currently implemented, the new exceptions will
percolate up to ComputeManager.update_available_resource_for_node like

commit_message:
Proper error handling by _ensure_resource_provider

Previously, if _ensure_resource_provider encountered any error from the
placement REST API, it would (sometimes log a message and) return None.

Furthermore, a name conflict while creating the provider was treated the
same as a UUID conflict, which would actually result in None being
returned.

With this change set, the error paths that previously returned None now
raise one of the new ResourceProviderRetrievalFailed or
ResourceProviderCreationFailed exceptions; and the name conflict path is
detected and treated as an error condition.

Note: This change set only touches the SchedulerReportClient side of
these error conditions - it makes no attempt to add error handling to
its callers.  Case in point, the API samples tests needed fixing because
they were previously running into the name conflict error condition, but
not noticing.  As currently implemented, the new exceptions will
percolate up to ComputeManager.update_available_resource_for_node like
any others coming from SchedulerReportClient, where they will be logged
and ignored.

Change-Id: I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36
Closes-Bug: #1735430

commit_message:
Add timestamp to cluster instance name

According bug description, when growing a database cluster,
instance names can overlap.  To solve this problem, use
timestamp as instanceName replace of increase numbers.

Change-Id: I6849390c56a26de9df96c16dec0e1c1a6e58e097
Closes-Bug: #1642416

messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-10 22:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-10 22:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to lxc-host-upgrade'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-13 09:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-13 14:01:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-02 05:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit d974c4db1696027899b28b2cb58800cae9a605e5'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-10 22:15:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add ExecStartPre command to lxc-dnsmasq service unit

When upgrading from an older deployment without the lxc-dnsmaq service
unit it's possible for the lxc-dnsmasq process to have been left in
a defunct state; this is especially true when upgrading as the
background process will have been started as a post-up command within the
lxcbr0 interface configuration. If the service is in a defunct state, or
running without a valid pid file, the systemd service unit will fail to
start.

This change ensures systemd will clean up all processes owned by the
lxc-dnsmaq user with a limited scope of processes matching a regex of
"^dnsmasq" which is only effectuve when the service is not managed by
systemd and in a defunct state.

Change-Id: If183f0b6dfbe0646384cf3bb3b89bc3901643c1e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add ExecStartPre command to lxc-dnsmasq service unit

When upgrading from an older deployment without the lxc-dnsmaq service
unit it's possible for the lxc-dnsmasq process to have been left in
a defunct state; this is especially true when upgrading as the
background process will have been started as a post-up command within the
lxcbr0 interface configuration. If the service is in a defunct state, or
running without a valid pid file, the systemd service unit will fail to
start.

This change ensures systemd will clean up all processes owned by the
lxc-dnsmaq user with a limited scope of processes matching a regex of
"^dnsmasq" which is only effectuve when the service is not managed by
systemd and in a defunct state.

Change-Id: If183f0b6dfbe0646384cf3bb3b89bc3901643c1e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 00:34:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the errored steps after they all responded

Removing steps during the initial loop could cause some issues and race
conditions.

This change makes it so the steps are filtered out after they all responded.
Since it waits for the global resolve to moves on, this change should not
make anything slower.

Closes-bug: #1702728
Change-Id: Iabfdd3445117b898251782969c3d915b802f440e
(cherry picked from commit e742950da140fa12d078b495a2b8da64c64bd142)
'}, {'created': '2017-11-16 00:37:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the errored steps after they all responded

Removing steps during the initial loop could cause some issues and race
conditions.

This change makes it so the steps are filtered out after they all responded.
Since it waits for the global resolve to moves on, this change should not
make anything slower.

Closes-bug: #1702728
Change-Id: Iabfdd3445117b898251782969c3d915b802f440e
(cherry picked from commit e742950da140fa12d078b495a2b8da64c64bd142)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the errored steps after they all responded

Removing steps during the initial loop could cause some issues and race
conditions.

This change makes it so the steps are filtered out after they all responded.
Since it waits for the global resolve to moves on, this change should not
make anything slower.

Closes-bug: #1702728
Change-Id: Iabfdd3445117b898251782969c3d915b802f440e
(cherry picked from commit e742950da140fa12d078b495a2b8da64c64bd142)

commit_message:
Update job skip condition

There is no need to run tempest job for changes only with translations.

Also adds openstack_auth/locale/ to the skip condition.

Change-Id: I9b21de25a06cb08d1a08dd91637cd0135bf937be
